This example shows that jobs that are related to technology are in demand in most of the countries.Some people might argue that there are some cultures such as making foods which are unicq in each culture, and technology cannot affect them. This point has some merits on the surface; however, many countries such as Canada, the USA, and British have many restaurants which serve many foods form different countries and cultures. In fact, cooks can find many new food recipes easily on the Internet. For example, two days ago, I went to a Canadian restaurant, and I ate noodle, sushi, which are Chinese foods, and Greek salad.To sum up, new technology has affected cultures of the world, and we can see many similarities in many cultures. In fact, new technology has influences on educational system, jobs and foods in the world.
llm: In the modern era of global interconnectedness, technology has been instrumental in shaping a unified global culture, despite the complexities involved. The notion that technology is creating a homogeneous cultural landscape is one that I support, primarily driven by the advent of the internet, social media, and global communication networks.One of the primary ways in which technology achieves this is through the internet, which acts as a robust medium for cultural exchange. It enables individuals from varied backgrounds to exchange ideas, cultural practices, and ways of life. Social media platforms like YouTube, TikTok, and Instagram have made it possible for users worldwide to access, engage with, and share global content. A notable example is the global phenomenon of K-pop, which has successfully transitioned from a local genre to an internationally recognized form of music, thereby creating a shared musical experience that transcends geographical boundaries. This not only fosters a unified taste in music but also encourages the fusion of cultural influences, leading to the creation of hybrid artistic expressions.Furthermore, social media plays a vital role in unifying cultural narratives and values across the globe. Global movements, such as activism for climate change and social justice, gain momentum through the use of universal hashtags. This interconnectedness facilitates a unified voice that can challenge local norms and inspire collective action, demonstrating the power of modern technology in reshaping cultural paradigms.However, it's essential to acknowledge that while technology contributes to the development of a global culture, it does not eradicate local cultures. Instead, it often initiates a dialogue between global and local cultures, prompting individuals to redefine their identities in innovative ways. While traditional customs and practices are preserved, they are increasingly influenced by global cultural trends, leading to a dynamic interchange between the global and the local.In conclusion, technology is undoubtedly a driving force behind the emergence of a single, unified world culture, facilitated by cross-cultural interactions and shared global experiences. Although this trend poses challenges to the diversity of cultures, it also presents opportunities for deeper dialogue and mutual understanding among diverse cultures, ultimately enriching our global cultural tapestry.

question: Do you agree or disagree with the following statement: Nowadays it is much easier to achieve success with the help from one's family than what is like before
human: There are many factors that contribute to one's success. However, which factor is the most influential one is open to debate. Some people believe that nowadays the assitance from family is quite a essential factor in one's success. It seems that one can achieve success more easily with the help from his or her family. I agree with this statement. In my opinion, family plays a more important role in helping one to pursuit success. There are a couple of reasons.First of all, more and more people have the opportunity to receive education from university. Since our parents receive better education than our grandparents did, they can provide more advices and helps in our career. In the past, seldom people have the chance to attend a collage. For example, my grandparents did not get a education even in high school, so when my father had difficulty in solving a problem in his childhood, he had to go to his teacher for help. Things have changed a lot. I grow up in a better condition than my father did. Whenever I have problems, I can always ask my parents for help. They can solve the problem quickly because they have learned quite a lot. What is more, family members can help us in many other aspects. For example, when I did not know what major to choose when I attend university, my father told a lot about different majors. He shared his own experience with me, which helped me quite a lot. Parents are quite experienced than their child, they can guide them toward the right direction. Besides, parents can told their children as many as they can. What they want is help their child to make a progress.In a word, our parents and other family members can help us a lot in our life. I believe that with the help of our family, we can achieve success quite easily.
llm: The notion that achieving success is significantly easier with the support of one's family holds considerable truth in today's world. The role of familial support in individual achievements has always been vital, but its nature and extent have undergone a profound transformation over time, making it more accessible and effective.One major factor is the revolution in modern communication technologies, which has fundamentally altered the way families interact. Unlike the past, where geographical distances often kept family members apart and limited their ability to provide guidance and support, today's instant messaging, video calls, and social media platforms enable family members to offer encouragement and advice from anywhere. This ease of access allows individuals to draw on their family's experiences and wisdom at crucial moments in their personal and professional lives.Furthermore, the dynamics within modern families have evolved to become more collaborative and supportive. Many families now prioritize education and personal development, stressing the importance of pursuing one's passions and goals. Parents are more likely to invest time and resources in developing their children's skills, whether through tutoring, mentorship, or emotional support, thereby laying a strong foundation for future success.The definition of success itself has also broadened, now encompassing not just financial achievements but also mental wellbeing, fulfillment, and happiness. This shift in understanding means families can foster a supportive environment that encourages the pursuit of a wide range of aspirations, thereby enhancing their members' chances of achieving success.However, it's crucial to recognize that not all families have the capacity to offer such support due to societal and economic disparities that can limit a family's ability to aid its members. Despite this, for those with supportive family networks, the available resources and encouragement provide a significant advantage in pursuing success, arguably making it easier than in previous generations.In conclusion, the modern family plays a central role in fostering success by advocating for and supporting individuals in more holistic and accessible ways than ever before, thereby underscoring the significant merit in the assertion that family support is key to achieving success in today's world.

question: Do you agree or disagree with the following statement? Reading fiction (such as novels and short stories) is more enjoyable than watching movies. Use specific reasons and examples to explain your position.
human: There are many different opinions regarding hobbies. Some people would rather watch TV. However, in my view, reading fiction is more enjoyable than watching movies for the following reasons.Firstly, fiction books pay more attention to details. In fact, we can know characters, places, and times of a novel very well during reading it. Most of the novels describe not only main characters but also other people in the novels, where each scene is happening. For example, after I read animal farms which is a story of Russian revolution, I could understand the leaders and different segments of the Russian people. However, a movie just gives us a very small review of its stories and characters.Secondly, reading a novel is more convenient. Some novels have around 100 pages and readers cannot finish them in just one hour. Yet these people can continue to read their novels wherever they find free time such as in bus or trains. For example, I have started to read a novel since last week. I do not have enough time to read a novel in one day, so I usually read it when I am coming home from English class. In contrast, I cannot watch a complete movie because I can just sit in front of TV for 15 minutes and after that, I have to study.Some people might argue that people enjoy watching TV when they know they can learn many things such as learning a language by watching movies. This point has some merits on the surface; however, movies are not a good idea to learn a language for beginners since characters in movies speak very fast and unclear for language learners. For these learners it is better to start by reading some novels which are more comprehensible and enjoyable.To sum up, reading fictions is more pleasant because these books have more depth, are much easier to use, and more useful for language learners.
llm: The age-old debate between reading fiction and watching movies has been a longstanding topic of discussion among audiences, and I strongly believe that reading fiction surpasses the enjoyment of watching films. Although both mediums offer unique storytelling experiences, literature provides a more immersive experience than cinema.I prefer reading fiction for several reasons, primarily due to the depth and richness it offers. Novels allow readers to delve into the intricate thoughts, emotions, and motivations of characters, fostering a deeper connection with them. This is often lacking in movie adaptations, which prioritize visual storytelling over psychological depth. For instance, in Jane Austen's "Pride and Prejudice", readers can intimately follow Elizabeth Bennet's evolving feelings towards Mr. Darcy, an experience that is often oversimplified in screen adaptations.Furthermore, reading stimulates the imagination in ways that watching movies cannot. When reading a fictional narrative, readers must use their imagination to visualize settings, create characters' appearances, and interpret the story in their own way. This process encourages cognitive engagement, personal reflection, and creativity. In contrast, movies provide a passive experience, where the visuals are predetermined by the director's vision, limiting the viewer's imaginative participation.Another advantage of reading is the ability to control the pacing of the story. Readers can choose to slow down or speed up their reading, allowing them to fully absorb and appreciate the narrative. Movies, on the other hand, are paced by the director, which can result in rushed or dragged-out scenes.In conclusion, while both literature and cinema have their own merits, reading fiction offers a more enriching and enjoyable experience due to its depth, imaginative engagement, and personalized pacing. Embracing the world of novels and short stories not only cultivates a love for storytelling but also enhances our ability to empathize and think critically, making it a more rewarding pursuit overall.

question: Several languages die every year. Many people feel this is a positive trend and that a world with fewer language promotes harmony and understanding between people. Analyze both sides of this argument and provide your opinion.
human: Today, English is commonly used language across the world. Its usage is increasing day by day. As a consequence, various local languages are becoming extinct. Some people argue that, this is a positive change and would help people to easily communicate. While there are others who disagree with this and are more concerned about dying local languages. In my opinion, I believe using single language through out the world is a positive change which is helping the world to become a better place to live.A world with fewer languages helps us interact with each other in a better way. Due to globalization, many people are traveling for professional trips. So, communicating in single language will reduce the problems of travelers in daily activities like ordering food in a restaurant or in going around places. Furthermore, students who migrate for better education would not have to go through lot of stress as they can easily make new friends and can be part of any discussions which is otherwise not possible in a world with multiple languages; this in turn makes it easy to adjust in new environment. Single language also reduces misunderstandings between people. Adding to that, exchange of knowledge in different sectors of research like electronics, medical, astronomy etc would become easier.On the other hand, few people are worried about the dying local languages. These languages are the basis for the origination and initial communication between different cultures. They represent local culture. As the usage of these languages decrease, culture also changes accordingly. Further, these languages are tightly coupled with history; all the olden day literature and scripts will be impossible to decipher if these languages are lost.To conclude, I believe change is inevitable and that usage of one language across the world is a positive one. We have to accept these changes for a world to be a better place. Communication in single language would improve the productivity of the world and brings everyone on to the same page.
llm: The issue of language extinction has sparked intense debate in recent years, with opinions strongly polarized on whether the decline of languages is beneficial or harmful to the global community. On one hand, proponents of language extinction claim that a reduction in the number of languages can improve communication and understanding among individuals. In a world where global connections are increasingly prevalent, a shared language can facilitate diplomacy, business, and cooperation across various sectors. The reasoning behind this argument is that when people share a common language, misunderstandings and miscommunications can be minimized, thereby promoting global unity and cohesion.On the other hand, critics of this viewpoint emphasize the significant cultural and intellectual losses that occur when languages disappear. Each language embodies a distinct perspective, history, tradition, and identity, contributing to the rich diversity of human experience. The loss of a language puts an entire corpus of knowledge and cultural heritage at risk of being lost forever. Indigenous languages, in particular, contain valuable insights into ecosystems, medicine, and social practices that are often not documented elsewhere. Consequently, linguistic diversity enriches humanity's collective experience, offering diverse ways of perceiving and interacting with the world.In my opinion, while the convenience of communication in a single language is appealing, the loss of linguistic diversity poses a greater threat to cultural richness and human experience. Language extinction represents not just a reduction in communication methods, but the erasure of irreplaceable cultural identities and histories. Instead of accepting language extinction, efforts should be made to promote multilingualism and preserve endangered languages. Supporting linguistic diversity can lead to a deeper understanding and appreciation of different cultures, ultimately fostering genuine harmony that goes beyond mere communication. In conclusion, preserving languages is essential for maintaining cultural heritage and promoting a truly inclusive global society.

question: Elderly people think that the way they spent their life was simpler and better than today. Do you agree or disagree? Provide you reasons and real life example
human: Changes are inseparable parts of this world which normally humans are responsible for by manipulating the environment they live in. Sometimes these changes adversely affect our lives that make elderly people think they used to live in a better world than the modern world the younger generation are experiencing. I utterly disagree with this opinion due to technological and medical reasons.We live in an era that technology is developing in the speed of light, steering the world toward a much more convenient place. A clear-cut example that supports this idea is the invention of smart phones. The strong navigation system installed on the phones has been rescued lives of many who left alone in remote areas like forests or deserts. Moreover, some people criticize social networks as tools that have ruined true relationships and friendships by reducing face-to-face communication. In my opinion though, social networks such as Facebook could foster the ties between friends and family members who are obligatorily far away from each other by keeping them in touch, the thing that was impossible less than 20 years ago. The phenomenal progress in medical science in the last decade was a huge achievement for human being to make the world a healthier and, thus, a happier place to live in. Today, even some disabled people with serious vertebral injuries can start doing physical activities like walking again thanks to the continuingly efforts of biomechanical engineers and neurologists. The advancement in drug delivery systems is another example that could save lives. To be specific, scientists could invent ways to lead drugs directly to the damaged organs of the body, which is a miraculous breakthrough. In general, the increase in the average age of human from 50 to around 75 years through last decades is a strong evidence to show how successful human was in medicine.In conclusion, even though the people from older generation may claim they had better life as there were stronger bonds between family members and friends, I think they are wrong, since they judge the contemporary age through a personal prejudice. In light of the above-mentioned facts, one can easily conclude that in the current world living standards stand in a much higher level and people are in better conditions socially and physically.
llm: The notion that life was simpler and better in the past, particularly among the elderly, is a common sentiment in many cultures. Although there are valid arguments supporting the idea that life was indeed less complicated in the past, I think this view can be overly idealized and neglects the substantial progress and challenges that have taken place.One major reason why older individuals may view their past as superior is the more leisurely pace of life back then. In earlier decades, face-to-face interactions, letters, and landline phones facilitated stronger social bonds and a greater sense of community. Many retirees fondly recall the warmth of neighborhood gatherings and the less frantic lifestyle. This appreciation for time spent with loved ones contrasts sharply with the frenetic digital era, which overwhelms us with data and distractions.However, this portrayal of the past often glosses over the numerous difficulties that characterized those times. For instance, the limited medical advancements led to higher mortality rates and restricted access to healthcare. Diseases like polio or tuberculosis, which are now easily preventable or treatable, could ravage communities. Furthermore, societal norms and expectations resulted in significant inequalities, especially for marginalized groups, which many elderly individuals experienced firsthand.While nostalgia can evoke fond memories of simpler times, it's essential to acknowledge the advancements we've made. Modern amenities such as sophisticated healthcare, access to information, global connectivity, and improved living standards have significantly enhanced the quality of life for many people. Rather than viewing the past as unequivocally superior, it's more beneficial to appreciate both the benefits of modern life and the lessons learned from the past. This approach promotes a balanced perception, recognizing the complexities of both eras while embracing the progress of human society.

question: Some people say that all secondary school and higher school students should be taught how to manage money as its an important life skill. Do you agree or disagree with this argument?
human: There is no doubt that money has become key ingredient in various walks of our life than before. Teaching financial management to juvenile students is always a topic of debate. Some people feel that teaching money management skill to teenage students will help them realise the importance of money, while few feel that exposing children to money math at this age may turn fatal. In my view, I agree to that fact that higher school students should be made aware of the money management.The reason why I think teenage students need to understand the money management basics is, primarily when secondary school students attain the age of undergoing graduation, students ought to stay in hostels or with friends and away from family, during such situations when money management is taught at an early age students will have increased sense of responsibility and confidence. For example, while I was a kid my father used to maintain expense log for the month, I was asked to do the same for my keep track of my pocket money expenses, during my future course of life this became a practice and helped me in planning my expenses.In addition, if financial management is taught at an early age, students will have better sense of understanding of their family financial background and status, students coming up with unrealistic whims and fancies are minimized. For example, buying a gaming console may not be a big deal for a student from an affluent financial background. However, for a student coming from middle class buying a gaming console may not be the need of the hour. Hence, having exposed to money management at a high school level will help them in prioritizing the financial commitments efficiently.In conclusion, I think students understanding the money management techniques will have more positive effects than negative impact. However, the teaching should be in a constructive manner and students should not feel that they are being bullied for every expense.
llm: In the current complex and fast-paced financial environment, the discussion about whether secondary and higher education students should be taught money management is highly relevant and significant. I strongly believe that providing students with practical financial skills is crucial for their future success and well-being.The importance of financial literacy cannot be overstated. It is a vital life skill that enables individuals to make informed financial decisions. As students transition into adulthood, they face numerous financial responsibilities, including budgeting, saving, and investing. Without a solid foundation in financial knowledge, they may struggle to avoid debt, manage expenses, or make wise investment choices. By incorporating money management into school curricula, the risk of financial mistakes that could have long-term consequences, such as debt or poor credit ratings, can be significantly reduced.Furthermore, teaching financial education in schools prepares students for the financial challenges they will encounter in the real world. In an era where student loans and credit card debt are common, understanding concepts such as interest rates, inflation, and the importance of saving is essential. Financial literacy programs can help clarify these topics, allowing students to navigate their financial futures with confidence. Additionally, the earlier individuals develop good financial habits, the more likely they are to maintain them into adulthood.Moreover, teaching money management can also promote social equality. Students from diverse socio-economic backgrounds often have varying levels of access to financial knowledge. By providing a standard curriculum on money management, schools can help create a level playing field, ensuring that every individual has the tools to achieve financial stability and success, regardless of their background.In conclusion, integrating money management education into secondary and higher education is essential. Not only does it equip students with vital life skills, prepare them for the realities of adult financial responsibilities, and promote social equality, but it also fosters a generation that is financially literate and capable of making sound economic decisions. By doing so, we can empower students to make informed financial choices, achieve financial stability, and contribute to a more economically responsible society.

question: Some single people like to live with a roommate, while others prefer to live alone. Which would you prefer? Give specific reasons and examples to support your answer.
human: Many single people have difficulties deciding whether to live with a roommate or to live alone. Each makes different decisions. Some people choose to live alone for privacy, while others choose to live with a roommate for practical reasons. As far as I am concerned, I prefer to live with a roommate. This is because it saves me money, enables me to socialize, and allows me to get help.Living with a roommate saves me a lot of money. If you have roommates, you can split the rent and utilities among them. This means you can get more for less. For example, last year, I shared a room off-campus with my friend, and we decided to split the rent and heating bills into half: I was able to save about fifty dollars for heating, and two hundred dollars for rent monthly. I was able to save a lot of money by sharing wasted heating and rooms with my friend and splitting the bills.Apart from saving a lot of money, living with a roommate also enables me to socialize more easily. It is always easier to socialize when you have a lot of people around you. You can invite your roommates' friends over to your room and have fun together. For instance, one night, my roommate, Millan, brought his friends along. Even though his friends and I were total strangers to each other, we quickly got to know each other. We soon found out that everyone loved playing video games. We played a video game called 'Halo' together all night, and became good friends. Living with a roommate made socializing much easier for me.Finally, living with a roommate allows me to get help. It often is the case that your roommates have the skills or knowledge you need. When you run into a problem, you can ask your roommates if they can help. Some of them may have something to offer. To illustrate, when my computer mysteriously broke down, I dialed up the manufacturer and asked for help. They failed to give me any useful solutions. To my surprise, one of my roommates noticed my problems and offered to help. He was very good with computers, and he managed to fix the problem quickly.In conclusion, while many people decide to live alone for various reasons, I prefer to live with a roommate, and I always will. This is because it offers me many advantages, such as less spending, more socializing, and more help. I think single people should live with a roommate, if they want to enjoy their lives.
llm: For many single individuals, the decision to live alone or with a roommate is a crucial one, with each option offering its unique benefits and drawbacks. On a personal note, I favor living alone, driven by my desire for autonomy, personal space, and the freedom to craft my ideal living space.The primary advantage of living alone is the independence it affords. This independence allows me to make decisions about my daily schedule, social engagements, and household habits without needing to consider someone else's opinions or preferences. For example, I can host friends at late hours or pursue my hobbies without worrying about disturbing a roommate. This autonomy enables me to lead a lifestyle that truly reflects my priorities and tastes.Another significant benefit for me is having my own personal space. Living alone gives me complete authority over my living environment, from arranging furniture to selecting decorations. I can create a space that truly represents my personality and values, which is incredibly fulfilling. For instance, I can maintain a quiet and peaceful atmosphere that is perfect for studying or relaxation, free from the distractions that might come from a roommate's activities.Living alone also promotes self-sufficiency and personal development. It compels me to handle my finances, do chores, and resolve issues on my own, which nurtures a sense of responsibility and enhances my maturity. Although living with a roommate can offer opportunities for social interaction, the solitude of living alone provides valuable time for self-reflection and personal growth.In summary, while sharing a living space with a roommate can offer companionship and lower living expenses, my preference for living alone stems from the independence, control over my living space, and opportunities for personal growth it offers. This choice enables me to fully express my individuality and lead a lifestyle that truly resonates with me.

question: Do you agree or disagree with the following statement? Smoking should not be permitted in restaurants, and state laws that prohibit it should be upheld.
human: Generally speaking, smoking is never been good for human's body. There are so many researches done to prove that a cigar contains harmful ingredients for human's body. Although many smokers claim that they need to smoke in order to work more effectively or to think more creatively, those reasons never proves that smoking has any benefits for human's body. In my opinion, smoking should not be permitted, especially in public places like restaurants because it will make the non-smokers breathe uncomfortably.First of all, restaurants are places where people come and pay some money to enjoy their meals. Smoking in restaurants will absolutely disturb other people in enjoying their meals. They will not be able to enjoy their meals while breathing in smoke around them. Secondly, restaurants are places that people usually come with their families. This means, there will be children, grandparents, as well as pregnant women inside the restaurants. Smoking in restaurants can give a bad example to the children. Children have a high potential to imitate what adults do because they have really high curiosity towards something. Smoking in restaurants also can affect the elders' health, especially if they have problems with their hearts and lungs. The most dangerous people that would be affected by smoke are the pregnant women because they will breathe in the contaminated air and it will disrupt the growth of the babies.Last but not least, passive smokers will have a lot of health risks. When they are around the active smokers, they will inhale hazardous smoke. Stroke, heart disorders, hearing loss, and cancers are some diseases that can attack passive smokers. Personally speaking, it is unfair for passive smokers because they do not smoke but they have same health risks as the active one.In conclusion, smoking should not be permitted in restaurants because there will be a lot of people get disadvantaged. State laws that prohibit it should be upheld so the restaurant' management can make a clear rule in their restaurants because everyone has a right to enjoy their meals.
llm: The discussion about smoking in public areas, especially in restaurants, has gained significant attention in recent years. I strongly believe that smoking should be prohibited in restaurants and support the implementation of state laws that ban the practice. My position is based on concerns about public health, environmental quality, and individual rights.The primary reason for this stance is the substantial health risks associated with smoking, which affect not only smokers but also those exposed to secondhand smoke. The Centers for Disease Control and Prevention (CDC) report that secondhand smoke contains more than 7,000 chemicals, many of which are toxic and can cause serious health problems, including respiratory diseases and cancer. In restaurants, where people gather to eat and socialize, smoking can create an unhealthy atmosphere that jeopardizes public well-being. Therefore, laws prohibiting smoking in these establishments are crucial for safeguarding the health of patrons and employees.Furthermore, enforcing these laws enhances the overall dining experience. Many people prefer to eat in a smoke-free environment, and restaurants that enforce non-smoking policies often attract more customers by catering to the growing demographic that values health and comfort. This results in a mutually beneficial situation, where restaurants can increase revenue while prioritizing their guests' health.Additionally, supporting laws that prohibit smoking in restaurants aligns with the broader social trend towards healthier lifestyles. As people become more aware of the health implications of smoking, it is essential for legislation to reflect these values. Upholding state laws that ban smoking in restaurants is a necessary step towards fostering a culture of health awareness and responsibility.In summary, I firmly believe that smoking should be prohibited in restaurants, backed by state laws that safeguard the health and well-being of the community. Prioritizing public health is essential to ensure that dining areas are safe and enjoyable for everyone.

question: Do you agree or disagree with the following statement? Growing violence in films has affected youngsters in a negative way?
human: It's obvious that violent behavior is growing more in films in recent 20 years. This matter has been considered as a way to advertise a film. From my point of view, I believe that violence in movies has negative effects on youngsters mostly on their behaviors, emotions & study.In the first place, children behaviors are the most concerning matter which parents are always trying to do their best. Nowadays children are more involved in TV programs. Imagine an actor who is a child’s favorite is doing violent roles. In this case, the child would imitate the actor's behaviors in order to look like to him. Thus, unexpectedly the violent behavior has effected on child’s behaviors.Meanwhile, human beings are very sensitive, especially of youngsters. For instance, dying is always a disappointing happening. Furthermore, killing is worse. Therefore, if these scenes are in TV, they would probably have their negative effects on the viewer who could be a child.Finally, beside all above mentioned items, the study of youngsters shall always been controlled. For example, a child watches a frightening movie. On the other hand, he has to study for the exam. In this condition, because he is thinking about the movie or whatever has happened in it, it is obvious that he wouldn’t be able to concentrate on his study perfectly. Hence, the study of a youngster would affected terribly.In conclusion, I certainly can say that growing of violence in films have definitely negative effects on youngsters mostly on their study, emotions and behaviors. Therefore, I think this matter should be controlled by parents or somehow by directors.
llm: The issue of whether the rising level of violence in films is having a negative impact on young people is a highly relevant and pressing concern that requires thoughtful consideration. In my opinion, the increasing depiction of violence in movies is indeed having a harmful effect on younger viewers, leading to desensitization, aggressive behavior, and a distorted view of reality.The repeated exposure of young people to violent images can lead to a loss of emotional response, making them less reactive to the seriousness of violence and more likely to view it as an acceptable way to resolve conflicts. Research has demonstrated that this desensitization can result in a reduced capacity for empathy and compassion towards victims of real-life violence. For instance, when children and adolescents are constantly exposed to disturbing scenes, they may become numb to the gravity of violence.Furthermore, the portrayal of violence in films is often glamorized, depicting it as exciting and appealing. This can create a false impression among young audiences that aggression and hostility are effective ways to manage personal conflicts or assert power. Studies have shown a link between watching violent films and an increase in aggressive behavior among children. Instead of learning constructive methods of conflict resolution, young people may imitate the violent behaviors they see on screen, resulting in a higher incidence of bullying and other forms of aggression.Additionally, the explicit depiction of violence can distort young people's understanding of societal norms and values. Films often show violence without the consequences that would normally follow in real life, fostering a false belief that such actions can be taken without repercussions. This distorted view can shape their perspective on justice, morality, and ethics, potentially leading to antisocial behavior as they interact with others.In conclusion, it is clear that the growing level of violence in films is having a negative impact on young people. The risks of desensitization, the normalization of aggressive behavior, and the distorted perception of reality necessitate a critical examination of the content presented to young audiences. As responsible stewards of media consumption, it is essential to promote responsible viewing habits that prioritize the emotional and psychological well-being of our youth.

question: Agree or disagree: In order to be well-informed, a person must get information from many different news sources.
human: Nowadays information plays an important role in our world. It has become a product, which can be sold, bought, or stolen. Some people say: "information is power". That's why it is so important to be well-informed. I consider the statement above to be right for several reasons.The first reason is that by using different sources of information we can guarantee its reliability. Some people may disinform you on purpose, that's why it is rather unwise to make conclusions before you are confident of the information. For example, Russian news announced that the war between Osetia and Georgia had been initiated by Georgia, however, european news announced that it was initiated by Russia. After a while the situation became clear, but before that a lot of people had already condemned the actions of Russia.Secondly, it is very important to know facts about some events or problem, not only estimations, because it can help you to make your own conclusion or estimate. Sometimes it can be really difficult to find out the facts, especially in the internet, that's why you have to look through different sources before you manage to find some reliable facts. It is possible to make a wrong decision because you have just used someone's personal opinion as a source of information, but it was actually wrong. For example, several years ago in Moscow salt became two times more expensive only in one week, because people thought that soon there would be no salt in the shops. The gossip-based information dramatically influenced the prices and only after official announcement the "salt-panic" was over. To conclude, I want to say that it is very important to be confident of the information, which you use, especially when your conclusion or decision may have a great influence.
llm: In today's digital age, where information is abundant and easily accessible, it is more important than ever to consult multiple news sources to stay informed. I strongly support this idea, as relying on a single source of information can lead to a distorted view of current events and issues.First and foremost, different news outlets have distinct editorial perspectives, biases, and reporting styles, which can result in vastly different portrayals of the same story. For instance, a news article in a conservative publication may present facts in a way that supports its ideological stance, while a liberal outlet may report on the same story from a completely different angle. By reading a wide range of news sources, including those with different political leanings and formats such as print, online, and broadcast media, readers can gain a more comprehensive and nuanced understanding of the topics at hand. This broader perspective is essential for forming balanced opinions and making informed decisions.Moreover, the concept of selective exposure, where people seek out information that confirms their pre-existing beliefs, can lead to the spread of misinformation and polarization. When individuals only follow a single news source, they are likely to miss out on important viewpoints and essential facts. Engaging with diverse perspectives not only helps to counteract confirmation bias but also encourages critical thinking, enabling individuals to evaluate the credibility of the information presented to them.Additionally, in an era where misinformation and fake news can spread rapidly through social media, consulting multiple news sources serves as a safeguard against deception. To be well-informed, one must be able to distinguish between credible reporting and misleading information, and the best way to achieve this is by conducting comprehensive research across various outlets.In conclusion, consulting multiple news sources is vital for anyone seeking to stay well-informed. It promotes a deeper understanding of complex issues, combats bias, and enhances critical analytical skills, ultimately contributing to a more informed and enlightened society.

question: Some people argue that there is no point in persevering old buildings when land is so valuable in our cities. Others believe that old buildings are important part of our heritage and should be preserved. Discuss both these views and state your opinion.
human: The preservation of old buildings always is a large question for governments because conflict between the issues of housing for citizens and the protection of our culture. In my opinion, all of the old building which contribute to our sense of culture should be conserved.There are different reasons which persuade that people should not restore old buildings. As a result of the rapid urbanization process, in which rural people must go to urban centers to look for job opportunities, the question of the preservation of old buildings has become more pressing. Because of that need, governments can construct more accommodation instead of preserving old buildings. Besides that, the preservation is very expensive because all components of old buildings have historical values. Old buildings are an essential part of history. Tourist often decide to discover the culture of a country when they visit through those old buildings. Therefore, managers of cities can earn more money from the attraction provided by old buildings and that amount can be spent on their conservation. Furthermore, the preservation of old buildings is also a ways to conserve our culture and everyone can learn much from them. Old buildings should be used as the culture museums and provide accommodation with more convenient for people who live there. . Many cities have development strategies as a city contains both unique and modern beauty, and that preservation help to finish half of work.	Overall, both of those view have strong arguments: the need for housing or the expense of restoration contrast with our desire to conserve culture and attract tourism. So I think we should restore those building because old buildings process the most outstanding feature of areas which contain them.
llm: The discussion around preserving old buildings versus pursuing new development in urban areas is multifaceted, echoing the broader values of society concerning history, culture, and economic expansion. Proponents of redevelopment argue that urban land is a scarce and valuable asset, and with the rising demand for housing and commercial spaces, especially in densely populated cities, removing old structures seems like a sensible solution. They claim that replacing or repurposing old buildings with modern developments optimizes land usage and boosts economic activity by providing space for contemporary businesses and residences that cater to current market demands.However, advocates for preserving old buildings stress the significance of cultural legacy and historical backdrop. Old buildings often narrate the history of a city, embodying architectural styles and craftsmanship that reflect the community's history, values, and identity. Preserving these structures can nurture a sense of community and continuity, enriching the urban landscape and boosting tourism. They also serve as landmarks, connecting future generations to their past. Moreover, many old buildings have one-of-a-kind design elements and materials that cannot be replicated in modern construction, thus enhancing the aesthetic and cultural worth of urban spaces.In my view, while the pressures of urban growth and space needs are undeniable, finding a balance is crucial. Rather than seeing old buildings as mere obstacles to development, cities should adopt adaptive reuse strategies, where these structures are repurposed for modern uses while maintaining their historical importance. This method not only preserves cultural heritage but also supports sustainable development, creating urban settings that honor the past and accommodate the future.

question: Nowadays, many young people say that mobile phones are the most important thing in their life. Do you think the popularity of mobile phones to young people is a good or bad development? Give relevant examples from your own experience.
human: Nowadays, many young people consider mobile phone as the most important thing in their lives as it keeps them constantly organized and it provides much convenience for them to reach out their families and friends. Despite all these positive aspects, I think that the popularity of mobile phones to the young generation is a bad development.First of all, many young owners of cellular phones are struggling at school because they are distracted most of the time with their phones. Games and applications installed in phones have occupied much of their time, leaving them lesser time for their studies and other school activities. Similarly, internet capable phones help influence the young ones to become more interested in chatting and social sites rather than doing school works. In my college days, I was once addicted to a certain game on my cellular phone. I have spent most of my time trying to reach a higher level to show-off to my friends. That goal has led me to my lost in interest on doing my homework and I ended up failing one subject in that semester.Secondly, juveniles who possess mobile phones have great tendencies to become materialistic. They would not only purchase a phone because of its functionality but also for its brand. Relatively, these do not come at a significant and inexpensive cost. Furthermore, most of these juveniles are students so they would need their parents to support them financially for what they want. An illustration of this unfortunate trend can be seen almost everywhere these days, wherein most teens at an early age own phones which are worth twice the salary of their parents. This clearly shows that the negative impacts brought about by mobile phones are harmful to a person’s education and character. Therefore, I highly discourage the young ones to be overly dependent on mobile phones.
llm: The widespread use of mobile phones among young people has become a hallmark of modern life. Although some people think that this reliance on mobile phones is harmful, I believe that it has both beneficial and detrimental effects, reflecting the complexities of contemporary communication and lifestyles.On the one hand, mobile phones provide unparalleled access to information and enable effortless communication. For example, young individuals can stay up-to-date with global events through news applications and social media, allowing them to participate in discussions and feel more connected to the world. Furthermore, mobile phones offer a wealth of educational resources at users' fingertips, facilitating more effective learning outside the classroom. My own experiences illustrate this advantage, as I frequently use my mobile phone to access online lectures and collaborate with classmates via messaging applications, thereby enhancing my academic experience.On the other hand, the pervasive use of mobile phones can have numerous negative consequences. Excessive screen time can hinder the development of essential social skills, leading to feelings of loneliness and isolation. I have observed, for instance, that friends who overuse their mobile phones during social gatherings tend to contribute less to conversations, creating an uncomfortable atmosphere. Moreover, the constant stream of social media notifications can lead to anxiety, distraction, and decreased mental well-being, ultimately affecting academic performance.In conclusion, the popularity of mobile phones among young people has brought significant benefits, such as improved access to information and enhanced communication. However, it also poses challenges that must be addressed. By adopting a balanced approach to mobile phone usage, young individuals can minimize the negative effects while maximizing the benefits, ultimately thriving in both their personal and academic lives.

question: Some people believe that there should be fixed punishments for each type of crime. Others, however,argue that the circumstances of an individual crime, and the motivation for committing it, should always be taken into account when deciding on the punishment.
human: Generally reason behind punishment is to reduce the crime from a nation and to build a fear in the mind of offenders. Some people think that it does not matter what is reason behind committing a crime therefore there should be fixed punishment for a specific crime. Alternatively I believe that it should taken into consideration the situation and conditions, that forces to a person to be a criminal.First of all if there will be a fixed punishment for each type of crime then it will lead to increase the crime because the punishment will be clear in the mind of professional criminals and they will not feel fear while committing a crime. Secondly, laws and rules are there for people therefore it is necessary to have a look behind crime for instance "a women steals feed for her child should be treated same as a women, who steals for her drug addiction". The person who committed crime first time and the professional criminals should not be imprisoned at same place.On the contrary, fixed punishment will reduce the time taken by judges to give their judgement and it will be effective economically for the Government. Everyone should be treated equally because sometimes we see that a poor person who do not have much money for hiring a good lawyer they get imprisoned even without committing a crime and when they come back to the society they become a professional criminal. Therefore fixed punishment will reduce the space between poor and rich people and everyone will understand the importance of each other.To conclude, Government should decide for punishment case by case basis. In doing so crime can be eliminated from a nation and it is a responsibility of every individual to be in the favor of truth and respect the laws of our constitution.
llm: The discussion around whether to implement fixed punishments for each crime type or to consider individual circumstances during sentencing is intricate and has multiple facets. Those in favor of fixed punishments believe that a standardized system ensures fairness, equality, and consistency within the justice system. They argue that consistent penalties effectively deter crime by clearly communicating the consequences of specific actions. With predetermined penalties, individuals are less likely to believe they can avoid justice, and the system appears more efficient and less prone to bias.On the other hand, the opposing viewpoint advocates for a more nuanced approach, taking into account the unique circumstances surrounding each crime. Crimes can vary significantly in context and motivation - for example, a theft driven by financial desperation versus one committed out of greed. By examining the individual context, judges can make more informed decisions that prioritize justice, rehabilitation, and understanding over mere punishment. This approach promotes a more compassionate justice system, where individuals can learn from their mistakes rather than receiving blanket penalties that fail to address the underlying causes of their behavior.Moreover, inflexible sentencing can result in punishments that are disproportionate and overlook a person's background, mental health, or coercive circumstances. For instance, a young person from a troubled background may react differently to a situation compared to an adult acting with full intention. Therefore, allowing flexibility in sentencing enables more tailored and constructive outcomes.In summary, although fixed punishments provide clarity and uniformity, considering individual circumstances during sentencing can lead to a more just and effective justice system. By balancing the need for consistent legal standards with the recognition of personal circumstances, it's possible to create a system that upholds both justice and compassion.

question: Some people prefer to spend their free time outdoors. Other people prefer to spend their leisure time indoors. Would you prefer to be outside or would you prefer to be inside for your leisure activities? Use specific reasons and examples to explain your choice.
human: People often relax themselves by joining leisure activities. Some people prefer to spend their free time indoors. But from my experience, I myself prefer to spend my leisure time outdoors because I strongly feel that it is good for health and keep my body fit. Also, outdoor activities enable me to socialize with other people and enjoy natural beauty.There are strong advantages to spend leisure time outdoors. One benefit is that doing outdoor activities such as soccer and baseball is good for one's health. For instance, last year, I spent my summer time playing soccer and baseball. Playing baseball provided my upper body for hitting and throwing. Soccer, on the other hand, developed my lower body for kicking and endurance for playing full 90-minute-games. I belive that practicing these sports helped me greatly. Something else that is good is that playing these sports is to keep my body fit, make me ultimately refreshed. After that summer, my body is stronger and endurance is better. Outdoor activities not only improves my health but also gives me chances to communicate with more people. When I was ten years old, I was a shy girl. My mother took me to The National Camp. At first, I just ate and played alone. But on the third day, while I was swimming, a friendly girl came and greeted me, we became friend later and she taught me how to swim effectively. On the next day, we played together and she introduced me to her friends. Thanks to her and outdoor activities such as going skiing, climbing the mountain, I had a lot of friends since The National Camp. If, for example, I hadn't participate in that camping, I wouldn't have had many friends like today. Moreover, you can also enjoy the beautiful nature when doing some outdoor activities like going hiking, sunbathing, going biking. If you spend your spare time at home or something like that, you can't enjoy beautiful nature. Spending time outdoors, people can breathe fresh air, feel the warm sun on their face and enjoy the complete peace that only nature brings.Admittedly, indoor activities are fun. There's no doubt that indoor activities like reading a book, watching TV or listening to music can bring us lots of joy. Although I can also have fun in indoor activities, this advantage cannot outweigh the attractions coming from outdoor activities. After all, people are people and we have our own propensity. Leisure activities are one of them and I myself choose outdoor activities to spend my leisure time.
llm: When it comes to how I like to spend my free time, I have to say that being outdoors is my top choice. There are many reasons for this, including how good it is for my body and mind, and how it lets me connect with nature. One of the main reasons I love being outside is that it gives me a chance to be around nature, which always leaves me feeling refreshed and full of energy. Whether I'm hiking, biking, or just walking on the beach, I find that being in nature is amazing for my mood and energy. The beautiful views, the sounds of the wind, and the fresh air all come together to make me feel happy and calm. For example, I went on a hike recently and the views were so beautiful that they lifted my mood and made me feel connected to the world around me.Another great thing about being outside is that it's good for my physical health. Doing sports like soccer, running, or swimming encourages me to be more active. I really enjoy jogging early in the morning when it's quiet, which helps me get ready for the day and clears my mind. Exercising outside gives me a natural high and helps me feel more clear-headed and less stressed.Lastly, spending time outside is a great way to spend time with friends and family. Doing things like team sports or having a barbecue outside gives us a chance to bond and have fun together. This kind of togetherness is hard to find when we're inside, where things can feel more lonely, like when we're watching TV or reading.In the end, I love spending my free time outside because it lets me be around nature, get exercise, and spend time with people I care about. Being outside is a great way to relax and feel fulfilled, and it's a big part of how I like to spend my free time.

question: Many people think that cheap air travel should be encouraged because it gives ordinary people the freedom to travel further. However, others think that this leads to environmental problem, and so air travel should be more expensive in order to discourage people from having it. Discuss both sides and give your own opinion.
human: In recent years, many airlines offer to their customers more and more number of cheap flights. People have various different views about cheap air travel. Although there are good arguments in favour of this trend should be encouraged, I personally think that cheap flight can make many serious problem.It is undeniable that cheap air fares have broadened travel possibilities for many people, particularly for the lower income group. These days, millions of people can travel around the world for work or pleasure. They can develop their careers, broad their knowledge, and interact with many other people from varied cultural backgrounds. Moreover, travels also help to promote the tourist industry development, boost the economy and job markets of many countries.On the other hand, growing of cheap flights really have negative impact on environment. Apparently, more flights could mean bigger and busier airport that may be grown the air pollution for people who live and work close to it. However, the biggest concern is the effect on global warming. Burning plane fuel can releases carbon dioxid into environment that cause the Earth to heat up. In fact, while many efforts are being made to reduce CO2 emissions from cars and factories, nothing is being done to reins the airlines. In conclusion, I would argue that the drawbacks of cheap air fares outweigh the benefits. However, it does not mean that air travel should be more expensive. Instead, people should be aware of their responsibility to reduce the emissions caused by their lifestyle choices.
llm: The discussion about affordable air travel is often characterized by two distinct viewpoints. On one hand, proponents of budget-friendly air travel highlight its ability to make mobility more inclusive, providing ordinary individuals with the chance to visit far-off destinations. Low-cost airlines have transformed the travel landscape by making flying more accessible to people who may have previously considered it a luxury. This increased accessibility promotes cultural exchange, stimulates local economies through tourism, and enriches personal experiences by allowing people to explore diverse environments.On the other hand, critics contend that while cheap air travel expands our horizons, it also worsens environmental problems. The aviation sector is a significant source of greenhouse gas emissions, and the surge in flights resulting from lower fares can lead to increased pollution and depletion of natural resources. As air travel becomes more frequent, its environmental consequences intensify, posing a threat not only to the climate but also to biodiversity. As a result, some argue that increasing ticket prices could discourage unnecessary travel and promote more sustainable behaviors, such as opting for trains or choosing local destinations that require less carbon-intensive transportation methods.In my view, a balanced approach is necessary. By promoting alternative modes of transportation, such as high-speed trains, alongside affordable air travel, we can mitigate some of the environmental impacts. Implementing carbon offset initiatives and promoting sustainable aviation technologies may also help reduce the carbon footprint of air travel without limiting accessibility. Raising awareness about the environmental effects of air travel can foster a more mindful travel culture, where people make more informed choices.To sum up, while affordable air travel promotes personal freedom and economic growth, it is crucial that we address its negative environmental consequences. Finding a balance that allows for exploration without compromising the planet's well-being is essential for the sake of future generations.

question: Some people prefer to live in a small town. Others prefer to live in big city. Which place would you prefer to live in? Use specific examples to support your answer.Ê
human: There are undeniable advantages to both life in a big city and in a small town. The former offers more excitement and convenience while the latter offers a cleaner, quieter and often friendlier place to live. However, despite the advantages of small town life, I prefer to live in a big city for several reasons.On the one hand, I have always wanted to find a job in a big company which locates in a prosperous city area. To make it convenient, I will absolutely choose a place to live that is not too far from my workplace. What's more I can save plenty of money on transportation if I choose to live in the city.On the other hand, life in a big city will not be so dull as in a small town. You can enjoy modern life and have more access to the advanced facilities. For instance, you can visit museums to learn history, and go to a more equipped library to enjoy reading, or you can go to a sports center for exercising. But a small town may be less developed to satisfy all these kinds of needs.Furthermore living in big cities means more exposure to stimulation, like all kinds of information. If one can efficiently acquire the information, then, there might come along more opportunities for him to achieve his goals. For example, there are various advertisements here an there, whether on the leaflets or on the big screen showing things of all sorts in commercial zones. If one is seeking a job right in the city or planing somewhere to travel, or just wants to buy a product in a dependable store, he might refer to what he has seen or heard from the advertisements to make a relatively wise choice. There is also another obvious advantage of living in a big city considering the chance of receiving better education of our offspring. Schools in big cities may receive more funds from whether the local comities or the government, which may make them more equipped with advanced teaching facilities and attract more excellent teachers. Our children thus will have a better chance of pursuing high-quality education which is very important for their future development. In conclusion, if I want to live a more convenient life with more access to modern facilities as well as with more exposure to various opportunities, and have my children receive a better education, a big city is the place to live in.
llm: The decision to live in a small town versus a big city is often a matter of personal preference and values. Although both have their advantages, I am drawn to the quaintness and peacefulness of a small town.A significant benefit of residing in a small town is the strong sense of community and security that comes with it. In these close-knit communities, relationships are often more intimate and meaningful. Neighbors tend to be familiar with one another, frequently engaging in conversations and lending a helping hand when needed. For example, in my hometown, events like farmers' markets and festivals promote a strong sense of belonging among residents, who gather to celebrate their heritage and culture. This communal atmosphere fosters deeper connections and a sense of safety and support that can be elusive in the fast-paced environment of a big city.Furthermore, small towns usually offer a more leisurely pace of life, allowing for a more relaxed and rewarding lifestyle. The streets are less crowded, and the daily rush is replaced by an abundance of green spaces and nature. Growing up, I enjoyed spending time outdoors in nearby parks, where I could hike, cycle, or simply bask in the serenity that nature provided. This access to natural beauty is often lacking in urban settings, where it is overshadowed by concrete and constant traffic.Additionally, the cost of living in small towns is generally significantly lower than in big cities. Housing is often more affordable, enabling individuals and families to enjoy a better quality of life. With less financial pressure, residents can pursue a more balanced lifestyle, dedicating time to hobbies and personal interests rather than worrying about inflated housing costs and expenses.In conclusion, while big cities offer certain amenities and opportunities, I find the peacefulness, community spirit, and affordability of small towns to be far more appealing. The idyllic life they offer serves as a retreat from the demands and chaos of urban environments, making it an ideal choice for me.

question: Salary increases and promotions to new positions are not the only ways to reward employees for good work. What other rewards for good work can be effective in encouraging further good work? Use specific examples to support your response.
human: It is unquestionable that salary increases and promotions to new positions are very common way to reward employees for good work. Besides the methods, from my point of view, providing professional training can be effective in encouraging further good work. My arguments for this point are listed follows.Firstly, training time can provide employee interesting time outside working office to refresh their mind. Clearly, in company we always have to deal with so many stressful situations such as negotiating with difficult customer, complaining from boss, etc. Therefore, we can unleash uncomfortable in training classes by making new friends, joking in class, enjoying new knowledge.Secondly, employees fell that they are valuable if they are trained. In this case, the employees know that their company is investing on them for future development of their company. So obviously, they will think about develop long term career with their company. For another thing, employees will be very proud of themselves when they are provided training while others don't have this opportunity. Thirdly, providing training will make employees happy with their current job because it help them improve their professional business knowledge. Having professional training help employees gain more confidence in their business, so I believe that they will finish their jobs with excellent result. Of course, excellent working result will make them very happy as well as their boss.In conclusion, providing professional training as a reward for good work has many advantages. Training can help employees refresh their mind as well as make them happy, focus on work. Taking into account of all these factors, we may reach the conclusion that training can be effective in encouraging further good work.
llm: Beyond traditional salary increases and promotions, there are numerous alternative rewards that can motivate employees to maintain excellent performance. These incentives can lead to increased job satisfaction, loyalty, and a more productive work environment. A powerful non-monetary incentive is recognition, which can significantly enhance employee morale and motivation. For example, companies can establish an "Employee of the Month" program or hold regular meetings to acknowledge individual achievements. This approach not only validates the hard work of recognized employees but also motivates others to strive for similar recognition.Flexible work arrangements are another effective incentive. By offering employees the option to work from home or adjust their schedules, companies can help them achieve a better balance between work and personal life. Tech companies like Google often provide flexible working conditions, demonstrating trust in their employees' ability to manage their time effectively. This autonomy can result in increased productivity and a culture of responsibility.Investing in employees' professional growth is also a potent reward. Companies that provide opportunities for development demonstrate a commitment to their employees' career advancement. Access to training programs, workshops, and courses can make employees feel valued, encouraging loyalty. For instance, Deloitte's robust mentorship programs enhance employee skills and build a supportive work community.Additionally, team-building activities and wellness initiatives can foster a sense of camaraderie and engagement among employees. Organizing retreats, workshops, and wellness days can promote team unity and demonstrate a company's investment in employee well-being. Companies like Zappos, which prioritize community and culture, often achieve high levels of employee satisfaction.In conclusion, recognition, flexibility, professional development, and wellness initiatives are effective tools for motivating and rewarding employees, beyond traditional financial incentives. By creating an environment that values employee contributions and well-being, organizations can cultivate a motivated and committed workforce.

question: Some people believe that university students should be required to attend classes. Others believe that going to classes should be optional for students. Which point of view do you agree with? Use specific reasons and details to explain your answer.
human: Attending university's classes is one of activities that students have to do. However, class is not the only source of knowledge. Students also learn from other sources such as experience, libraries and other people. I think going to classes should be optional for students for the following reasons.Firstly, the reason why university students should not be required to attend class is sometimes the students in the university can learn better from other sources outside the class room. Student can also study by themselves in the library and focus on only the topic they do not understand. For example, I have a close friend who was in the same department with me in the university. She learned quickly and understood everything in class so fast. Thus, she rarely went to class but spent most time to understand confusing topic. Finally, she got very good grade when she was graduation.Secondly, students should not be required to attend classes because they can manage the time spending on classes to do other benefit things if they already understand topic in the class very well. In my experience, many times I did not attend biology class because my university does not require the students to attend classes. Also, I had already studied all biology topics before attending university. As a result, I spent the time of biology class to do my Chemistry research and got A+ for both biology and chemistry. In conclusion, I think the students should know what activities they should do at the time and have good management for their learning time. Also, they have to know how to deal with the effects from not attending classes. So that, attending classes in the university will not be required to the students anymore.
llm: The question of whether university students should be required to attend classes or have the option to skip them is a contentious issue in the world of education. In my opinion, mandatory class attendance is the way to go, and I have several strong arguments to support this stance.The most significant advantage of compulsory attendance is the face-to-face interaction it facilitates between students and professors. This interaction is crucial in creating a stimulating learning environment where students can engage in real-time discussions, ask questions, and participate in debates that help them grasp the subject matter more deeply. Engaging in these conversations not only improves knowledge retention but also enables students to develop vital skills like critical thinking and communication, which are highly valued in the job market. Students who miss classes may miss out on these valuable learning opportunities, which can negatively impact their academic performance.In addition to this, making attendance mandatory promotes a sense of responsibility among students. For many, university is a stepping stone to independence, but this transition can be tough. By requiring students to attend classes, they develop discipline, a sense of responsibility for their own learning, and essential time management skills. This structured approach helps students establish a routine that is vital for achieving success in their academic and professional lives. On the other hand, optional attendance may encourage students to procrastinate and show a lack of commitment to their studies.It's also worth noting the social benefits of attending classes. Universities are not just institutions for academic learning, but also for personal growth and networking. Interacting with peers in a classroom setting can lead to joint projects, study groups, and lasting friendships. These social interactions are a key part of the university experience and can greatly enhance a student's personal and professional development.To sum up, while some people may advocate for the flexibility of optional attendance, the advantages of requiring university students to attend classes – including improved learning, accountability, and social interaction – are too significant to ignore. A structured approach to attendance fosters a dynamic and supportive learning environment, ultimately preparing students for their future pursuits.

question: Some people prefer to live in a small town. Others prefer to live in big city. Which place would you prefer to live in?
human: In a few years I will finish my studying in the university and I will have to decide whether to live in a small town or a big city. As I am eager to get a good job and explore different places, I think I would prefer to live in a city.Big city life provides many opportunities. First of all, it will be easier for me to find an engineering job in the city. Electrical engineering deals with problems concerning electricity supply. Therefore, a big city can offer me many more vacancies than a small town.At the weekends, there is a great number of things to do in the metropolis. There are numerous bars, cafes and restaurants where I can go with my friends. Multinational cities have restaurants with different national cuisines. I am fond of Italian food, and if there is an Italian restaurant in the city, I will definitely visit it.A night club is an interesting place to visit for young people. There a person can listen to music, make new friends or enjoy a a drink alone. Cultural life of a metropolis is always an entertaining one. I am keen on museums and it would be a pleasure for me to spend several hours a week in front of famous paintings, sculptures or artifacts. On special dates, city offers free exhibitions which are available for everyone who is interested in art.What's more, cities have better medical facilities than in the countryside. This can at least assure me that if I feel bad, city can provide a high quality help. In conclusion, while small towns have picturesque nature and pure air, big cities offer countless amount of opportunities and entertainment places. Considering all the benefits, I would choose to live in a big city.
llm: The age-old debate between residing in a small town and a big city is a multifaceted one, encompassing various lifestyle aspects, personal inclinations, and societal norms. Although both options have their merits, my personal preference leans towards living in a small town.What I find particularly appealing about small-town living is the strong sense of community that tends to thrive in these environments. In smaller communities, residents often know and interact with their neighbors, fostering deeper, more meaningful relationships. This, in turn, creates a supportive atmosphere where individuals look out for one another. Local events, such as festivals and markets, provide ample opportunities for people to connect and form lasting bonds, which can be challenging to establish in the anonymous urban jungle. The close-knit ambiance of small towns cultivates a sense of belonging, often lacking in big cities.Moreover, small towns typically offer a more serene and peaceful way of life. The constant din and chaos of metropolitan areas can be overwhelming, with incessant noise and traffic contributing to heightened stress levels. In contrast, small towns are often nestled in picturesque natural surroundings, providing ample opportunities for outdoor pursuits like hiking, biking, and simply appreciating nature. This connection with the outdoors can substantially enhance one's quality of life, promoting improved mental and physical well-being.Another significant advantage of small towns is the generally lower cost of living. For instance, housing costs are often more affordable than in urban areas, allowing for a better balance between work and personal life.
