Moreover, parents provide their children the best social skills and knowledge in order to prepare for their children's future life.First, children are taught basic things, which influence their whole life, by their parents. As a baby, they do not know any thing all around but they learn everything from their parents. Parents always try to explain and describe tenderly all things in simple way so that their baby can understand and learn from that. Consequently, parents bring the whole world of wonderful and colorful thing into their baby's little mind.Second, parents train their child how to become a good person. They always make their children basically say thanks and apology in the right way. On the one hand, it is common that they try to explain who is a good or bad person. On the other hand, children are shown how to behave well with others. This seems to be easy but this can influence positively their future children and makes children's behavior better before they face the real world.Third, it is clear that parents are ones who loves their children most and always take care of their children. Thus, they tend to provide the best knowledge and advice from their experience for children. Unlike a professional, parents always support children and give them much social skill so they can communicate well with others and have good habit in life. In fact, parents' support is one factor which makes people succeed in their life.In conclusion, parents are really the best teachers who give us much knowledge and advice. Based on love, they always try their best to make good condition for their children development in order to prepare children's future life.
llm: I strongly support the notion that parents are the most effective educators for young children, as their impact on a child's early development is unparalleled. The role of parents in shaping a child's foundational skills, values, and understanding is crucial, as these elements form the basis of their future growth and development.Initially, parents are responsible for providing the first and most fundamental form of education. From birth, children begin learning through observing, imitating, and interacting with their parents. The home environment plays a vital role in nurturing essential life skills, such as motor skills, language development, and social interactions, which are often developed through play, conversations, and daily routines. This initial exposure not only facilitates educational development but also emotional growth, as parents offer the comfort and security that encourages children to explore and learn.Furthermore, parents are uniquely positioned to impart their values, ethics, and social norms to their children. Unlike traditional educational settings, which may not align with every family's beliefs or values, parents have the opportunity to teach their children what they deem important, right, and worthy of respect. This foundational understanding has a profound impact on a child's character and influences their decisions and actions throughout their lives.However, it is essential to recognize that while parents play a vital role in their children's early education, they are not the only educators. Other influential figures, such as professional teachers, caregivers, and the broader community, also contribute significantly to a child's learning experience, often bringing specialized knowledge and diverse perspectives that may not be available to parents.In conclusion, I firmly believe that parents are indeed the most significant educators for young children, as their influence during the formative years is profound and lasting. They equip children with the essential skills and values necessary to navigate life. Nevertheless, it is crucial to view parental teaching as complementary to, rather than a replacement for, the contributions made by other educators and the community at large.

question: Some people say that television has a bad influence to young children. To what extend do you agree or disagree?
human: Nowadays, we have undergone many technology innovations such as Tv. Many people say that television has negative effects on children, since it can be violent or inappropriate for children. However, I strongly believe that television has more positive effects than negative effects. There are two reasons to support my idea.First of all, television has useful and educational programs. Not only the up-to-date news, but also there are many programs which has educational purposes. If children can use those programs wisely, they can learn many information from it. For example, in Korea, there's program called EBS. It is targeted for children to teenager. We can study subjects through EBS lecture. Also, there are many documentary films such as the life of a great man in Korea. Using those education programs let people get a lot of inspirations instead of having negative effects. In addition, Tv is helpful to relieve our stresses. There are many Tv programs such as sports programs. Many children have a lot of stresses recently, since they have so much pressure about study. When they are watching sports programs, it's easy to relieve those stresses. As an example, I got too much stress from the school. So, I was quite aggressive, however. After I watch the soccer match between Korea and Japan, the stress was gone. Instead, this soccer match helped me to continue my academic career in the school, since it helped me to relieve my stress.In conclusion, of course, the television can have violent programs, however, if children can use Tv programs wisely, there are more positive effects than negative effects. Now that, it has useful and educational programs and quite helpful to relieve stresses for children. For these reasons, I strongly disagree with the statement that television has negative effects on children.
llm: The impact of television on young children has been a topic of debate since its inception, with some arguing that it has a negative influence. However, I believe that the issue lies not with the medium itself, but with the type of content and how it is consumed. Exposure to unsuitable content is a primary concern when it comes to children's television viewing. Many shows feature violence, offensive language, and negative stereotypes, which can have a distorting effect on young minds, leading to increased aggression and desensitization to violence. Moreover, excessive television watching can contribute to a sedentary lifestyle, resulting in health problems like obesity. Without proper parental oversight and guidelines, television can have detrimental effects on children.On the other hand, television also has the potential to be a valuable educational tool. Educational shows, documentaries, and well-made children's programs can spark curiosity, improve vocabulary, and introduce kids to diverse cultures and ideas. For example, shows like "Sesame Street" and "Blue Planet" are both entertaining and educational, teaching children about maths, language skills, and environmental awareness. The rise of streaming services has also made it easier for parents to choose content that aligns with their values and educational goals.In conclusion, while television can have a negative impact on children when consumed without discretion, it also has the potential for positive influence when used thoughtfully. The key to this is parental guidance, careful content selection, and creating an environment where children engage with educational and enriching programs. By taking an active role in children's media consumption, parents can help their kids navigate the complexities of television in a way that supports healthy development.

question: Businesses should hire employees for their entire lives. Do you agree or disagree. Use specific reasons and examples to support your answer.Ê
human: Many entrepreneurs hypothesize that it is safer to hire employees for their entire lives in order to ensure the productivity and efficiency of working. From my perspective, those assumptions are not only conservative but also out-of-date. I am biased towards the opposite side that businesses had better not employ the workers for the whole of their life because of the three main crucial reasons. First and foremost, various ideas and creativity from different people are indispensable for a company to flourish. The invaluable experience of senior employees can pass down to the young apprentices who get used to new job, but regularly give out creative and novel ideas. What's more, the rapid development in every field nowadays requires precise updates and access to new knowledge. Therefore, the youngsters are capable of meeting those standards. More importantly, they have activeness, inventiveness and enterprise which allow them to complete their jobs perfectly. These vital factors can decide whether the company can thrive or not.Secondly, the staff soon gets boring with their stable job in such a long time. At a certain time, they may presume that a securing job is the most important and necessary because they need to earn money to manage their life. Thereafter, the bulk of them realize that high promotion and competition can assist them to improve their skills and horizons also. Many people enjoy challenging them because they don not want to be monotonous and passive ones. The same-old-same-old environment soon makes them depressed, so this situation will have an adverse impact on the enterprise. Last but not least, the economic crisis and financial recession result in a tremendous increase in unemployment. In my opinion, the businesses ought to recruit many workers so as to tackle this aching issue. It enables the jobless to better their life and earn a living. Furthermore, the factories and companies will have abundant human sources to ensure the pace of manufacture and also devising lots of unique ideas. In a nutshell, varied characteristics of various people, feeling tired of having the same occupation and solving the unemployed problem drive me to agree with the statement that the employer should not hire the staff for a whole life. I believe that the brilliant bosses are conscious of the need for giving opportunities to diverse employees.
llm: The concept of hiring employees for life is a notion that warrants scrutiny. Although the traditional idea of lifelong employment may convey a sense of stability and dedication, I argue that it is no longer suitable for the modern job market. A more adaptable employment model is better suited to the ever-changing needs of both employees and employers in today's dynamic work environment.There are several reasons why lifelong employment is no longer viable. Firstly, the rapid pace of technological advancements demands that businesses be agile and responsive to stay competitive. As industries evolve, the necessary skills to succeed also change. Long-term employment can hinder this adaptability, as employees may become complacent in their roles and resistant to acquiring new skills. For example, the information technology and renewable energy sectors are constantly transforming, requiring employees who are willing to learn and adapt. Hiring employees for life can stifle innovation and limit the influx of fresh ideas that new employees can bring, ultimately detracting from a company's long-term success.Secondly, employees often strive for personal growth and career development. Many individuals experience changes in interests or life circumstances that prompt them to seek new opportunities. A lifelong job can lead to dissatisfaction if an employee feels unfulfilled or unchallenged. Moreover, companies benefit from a diverse workforce that includes new perspectives, experiences, and ideas. Hiring employees on a shorter-term basis allows for a rotation of talent that can revitalize a company's culture and drive innovation.Lastly, the modern workforce prioritizes work-life balance and flexibility. The growth of remote work and gig economies reflects a new reality in which employees prioritize autonomy over job security. Companies that embrace this trend can attract top talent who are increasingly looking for opportunities that align with their personal and professional goals.In conclusion, although the idea of lifelong employment may seem appealing, the realities of a rapidly changing business environment suggest that a more flexible and adaptive approach to hiring is necessary. Businesses should focus on fostering continuous learning and providing opportunities for growth, ultimately benefiting both employees and organizations. By adopting a more dynamic employment model, companies can stay competitive, drive innovation, and attract top talent in today's fast-paced job market.

question: Do you agree or disagree with the following statement? Childhood is the happiest time of a person's life. Use reasons and specific examples to support your opinion.
human: I agree with the statement that childhood is the happiest period of one's life. It's not only the lack of responsibilities and daily struggle that make childhood the happiest time of our lives, but also factors like learning lots of new things every day and freedom to imagine and say what you think.Starting with our adulthood, we are strictly bounded with our responsibilities in our daily lives. We are told at what hour we shall wake up, how we shall dress up and how we shall behave. Every action we make are watched closely and judged by the community. But during our childhood, though responsibilies exist, we are much more free to do what we would like to. Being late for school or laughing at a place where you aren't supposed to do not have consequences as serious as that would be if you were an adult. Another great thing about being a child is possibility learning new and interesting things about the world you live in every single day. Being a child means that you are new in this world and every single thing around you is there to be discovered by you. There are lots of new facts you can learn, stories you can listen to and things you can see. Therefore, childhood is the period of time in which a person is surprised most.Using your imagination and saying what you think freely is another great thing about being a child. Children are not judged about the things they say as much as the adults, and freedom to express yourself is a very important for developing a colorful imagination. In adulthood, people are forced to express themselves in boundaries, therefore they are in no way free to think or use their imagination.Childhood, in several aspects, is the happiest period of our lives. It's not only because of the nature of childhood and children, but also the way our lives are changed when we are adults. In an ideal world with less boundaries, social judgement and more freedom of thought, things could be different; but since this is not the case, it seems that we will always be missing our childhood days.
llm: The notion that childhood is the happiest time of a person's life is a sentiment that resonates deeply with me. The unbridled joy, freedom from worry, and innocence of youth converge to create an environment that is conducive to happiness. Several aspects of childhood contribute to its unique capacity for joy.One notable aspect is the ability of children to find delight in everyday experiences. Their enthusiasm is contagious, whether they're playing outdoors, discovering new games, or simply enjoying the thrill of running through the rain. Reflecting on my own childhood, I'm reminded of how a simple outing to the park with friends could effortlessly transform into an unforgettable adventure, replete with laughter and creativity. Unfortunately, as we grow older, the weight of adult responsibilities often overshadows these carefree moments, diminishing our capacity to derive joy from the simple things.Another characteristic of childhood is the absence of significant responsibilities. Unencumbered by the pressures of employment, financial obligations, and complex social expectations, children are free to explore and discover themselves without the burden of adult pressures. I recall numerous summer days spent exploring nearby woods, with the sole concern being to return home in time for dinner. Such moments of unadulterated freedom foster a profound sense of happiness that is seldom replicated in later life.Furthermore, childhood is a time when enduring bonds with family and friends are formed, giving rise to lasting memories of love and connection. The affection and support received during these years lay the groundwork for emotional well-being. Celebrations such as birthdays, holidays, and family gatherings during childhood are often imbued with love and joy, reinforcing the idea that these early years are particularly replete with happiness.In summary, while each stage of life has its unique joys and challenges, childhood undoubtedly occupies a special place as the happiest time. The amalgam of innocence, freedom, and emotional connections during this period culminates in a reservoir of joy that is frequently unmatched in subsequent years.

question: Learning about the past has no value on for those of us living the present. Do you agree or disagree? Use specific reasons and examples to support your answer.
human: Many people think that "Past has nothing to do with present, as time never stops, the next generations are completely different from the predecessors". Although it is true that life changes rapidly, there are many things in the past that we can learn about, such as mistakes, success and knowledge in many fields of study. First of all, the predecessors' mistakes are the first thing that we should consider when learning about the past. As everyone's life is too short to risk trying anything without any prepare, we all should learn about other's mistakes so that we can avoid making the same ones. Each mistake, from the smallest to the bigger one, is a treasure of experience, which, if we can make full use of, will make us well-prepared for many complicated situations of our life. Therefore, past obviously saves ourselves a bunch of failures and times.Secondly, people's success in the past is as significant as those mistakes. If the predecessors' mistakes are the indirect way that leads us to the goals, others' accomplishment can be served as the direct way. By looking into the ways other people use to achieve their targets, we have the chance to make those mine, put them into practice and, of course, be successful like them. For instance, Edison's statement "Genius is 1 percent inspiration and 99 percent perspiration" is still helpful for everyone today, and probably in the future. Last but not least, the past is the basis in which people can use to develope new knowledge, inventions. If it had not been for those knowledge in the past, we could never be as modern as today. How can America be the world's leading country if Columbus did not accidentally discover it in his search for India. How can the comtemporary scientists study the earth's gravity without the apple which fall on Newton's head. They are only some of many precious knowledge that the past presents us. We cannot ignore them in any way.All in all, the past's mistakes, success and knowledge all have crucial impact on people's lives today. We should make full use of the past, instead of ignoring it, for a better and brighter future.
llm: The idea that studying the past has no relevance to our current lives and future decisions is a misguided perspective that neglects the significant influence of history on our present and future. I strongly disagree with this viewpoint, and for good reason.Firstly, history offers valuable insights that can inform our decision-making in the present. By examining past errors, such as wars fueled by nationalism or the economic downturn of the Great Depression, we can learn from the consequences of our actions. This knowledge enables societies to develop policies that prevent similar mistakes from recurring. For example, the aftermath of World War II had a profound impact on modern international relations, prompting nations to prioritize diplomacy and cooperation, which in turn led to a decline in conflicts.Moreover, understanding history helps shape our sense of identity and continuity. Our present is deeply rooted in the legacies of our predecessors. Cultural traditions, social norms, and political systems have evolved over time, reflecting the imprint of historical events. The civil rights movements of the 20th century, for instance, continue to inform contemporary discussions about equality and justice, serving as a reminder that the struggle for human rights is an ongoing endeavor that demands vigilance and engagement. Without an appreciation for these historical contexts, individuals may lack a comprehensive understanding of their roles and responsibilities within society.Furthermore, engaging with history cultivates critical thinking skills. Analyzing historical events requires the evaluation of sources, consideration of multiple perspectives, and the ability to think critically. These skills are essential in today's world, where misinformation can spread quickly. By learning how to assess historical narratives, individuals are better equipped to navigate complex contemporary issues, such as climate change, global pandemics, and social inequality.In conclusion, dismissing the value of learning from the past is a serious error. History informs our choices, shapes our identities, and enhances our critical thinking abilities. Embracing the lessons of the past enriches our understanding of the present and prepares us for a more informed and conscientious future. By recognizing the significance of history, we can make more informed decisions, foster a deeper sense of identity and continuity, and develop the critical thinking skills necessary to navigate the complexities of the modern world.

question: Governments spent a lot of money for traveling outer space. Do you think the investment is reasonable? Give your own opinion and reasons to support you claim
human: Space exploration, for discovery of out of space, has been possible for human in the 20th century. The United state and Russia are the important countries that spend large budgets for the research of this subject. In my opinion, spending the budget for space exploration is an important activity to save living of humanity in the future. Many governments believe that space exploration is an activity that wastes the budget, while the essential challenge of humanity in the future would be the discovery of a new place for the living. In 20th century, although human being succeeded to achieve out of space by means of new technologies such as rockets, but finding a new place for living in another planet is impossible until now. In during history, our planet is threatening by many of other planets or stars and it is an enormous danger for living of humanity. Therefore, it is very significant to find a new place for living in other planets. Space exploration has used as a tools for military power in the cold war. In the future, many countries will try to prevent attach of other countries by using and invention new missiles. In the past, the space race happened between the United Stated and the Soviet Union. Both countries tried to send man to the moon and show their power to each other. As a result, space exploration will use as a military power for many countries.In summary, spending budget for space exploring is not the waste budget, because it may helps to save civilization of humanity. Although exploring space used for discovery of other planets, nowadays most of governments have used many rockets for military purposes and therefore the purposes of exploring space has altered.
llm: For centuries, humanity has been fascinated by the exploration of outer space, prompting governments worldwide to dedicate substantial resources to various space missions. Although some critics contend that the funds allocated to space travel could be more effectively utilized to address pressing issues on our planet, I firmly believe that such investments are not only justified but also vital for the future of our species.The primary reason for this is that space exploration is a key driver of technological innovation. The complexities and challenges of space travel necessitate the development of novel solutions, leading to the creation of state-of-the-art technologies that frequently have applications in our daily lives. Examples of this include advancements in materials science, telecommunications, and medical technology, all of which have been derived from research undertaken for space exploration. These technological breakthroughs contribute significantly to economic expansion and enhance the quality of life on Earth.In addition to driving technological progress, space exploration serves essential scientific purposes. Gaining insight into phenomena such as climate change, planetary geology, and the possibility of extraterrestrial life is heavily reliant on data gathered from space missions. This knowledge plays a critical role in addressing key global challenges, including environmental sustainability and resource management. By investing in space exploration, governments are also investing in our capacity to comprehend, predict, and potentially mitigate the impacts of global crises.Moreover, the pursuit of resources and habitats beyond Earth may become increasingly crucial as our planet's resources diminish. Investing in space travel not only lays the groundwork for the potential colonization of other planets but also presents opportunities for resource extraction, such as asteroid mining. This could help alleviate some of the pressures currently faced by our planet's overburdened natural resources.In conclusion, while the expenses associated with space exploration may appear considerable, the benefits garnered in terms of technological innovation, scientific understanding, and potential resources render it a reasonable and necessary investment. As we progress, the exploration of outer space may prove to be a pivotal factor in ensuring a sustainable future for humanity.

question: Do you agree with the following statement? Television has destroyed communication among friends and family. Use specific reasons and examples to support your opinion.Ê
human: Television is one of the greatest innovations that we use every day. Besides, watching television has some cons and at the same time has very good pros. However, while some people argue that TV has devastated communication among friends and families, I believe it has done the opposite. I think TV programs are among the popular topics in every day talk as well as a great time for gathering. In addition Modern TV has smart system that let you be connected with people.First, it's true watching TV take a lot of your day, nevertheless it makes people meet and start a conversation about what they watch at other times like weather forecast and sport programs.Second, people like having meals while they are watching TV. Families usually tend to watch television either with each other or friends. For example my friends and I used to sit together and enjoy watching movies using VHS player at nights. It was fun and a little bit similar to the cinema. Third, TV can be one of communication ways. Moreover, TV can be connected to multimedia devices that have smart operating system like Google TV, WDTV using Skype, tango and other apps. In addition Teenagers can play games online with their friends; therefore we can communicate with each other through TV. To sum up, TV may take some of your time away from your family and friends but it can also make family get together and help to get in conversation. As well as it's one way of recent communications, based on that I think TV helps you to get connected with people.
llm: The claim that television is responsible for the decline of communication among friends and family is a contentious topic that warrants discussion. Although it is undeniable that television has had a significant impact on the way people interact with each other, I only partially agree with this assertion. Instead of eroding communication, television has, in many cases, revolutionized and even improved it.One of the primary advantages of television is its ability to provide a shared topic of conversation among family members and friends. For example, a popular TV show can spark discussions, debates, and communal experiences. Families who watch the same programs often bond over their favorite characters or plot developments, fostering relationships that may not have formed without a shared interest. A prime illustration of this phenomenon is shows like "Game of Thrones" or "Stranger Things," which have captivated audiences and become subjects of discussion, thereby enriching interpersonal dynamics.Furthermore, the rise of streaming services has made global content accessible to a broader audience, enabling families and friends to explore diverse cultures and ideas together. This exposure can lead to meaningful conversations about societal issues, human experiences, or moral dilemmas presented in these shows, resulting in deeper understanding and empathy among viewers. In this context, television serves not only as a source of entertainment but also as a catalyst for dialogue and introspection.However, it is essential to acknowledge that excessive television consumption can lead to social disengagement. When individuals spend too much time watching screens, it can detract from face-to-face interactions. Finding a balance is crucial; moderate screen time can facilitate effective communication while still allowing viewers to enjoy the benefits of television.In conclusion, while television presents challenges to traditional communication patterns, it also offers opportunities for connection and dialogue. Rather than viewing it as a destructive force, it should be seen as a complex influence on the ways friends and family interact with each other. By recognizing both the positive and negative effects of television, we can harness its potential to enhance communication and foster meaningful relationships.

question: Do you agree or disagree with the following statement? Letting a friend make a mistake is better than taking action that risks destroying a friendship.Use specific reasons and examples to support your opinion.
human: There is an argument regrading weather letting a friend make a mistake is better than taking action that risks destroying a friendship. It is widely accepted by many people that a mistake will return sometimes terrible result. However, I believe that friendship is more important than mistake by a friend, although mistake is terrible. In this essay, I will present two reasons supporting my opinion. First of all, a mistake does not last for a long time but a friendship lasts forever. Anybody does not remember mistakes. If someone remembers mistake, he or she has a closed mind. I want to say that mistakes will be forgotten quickly. For example, my friend Lee made a mistake that he broke my precious gift. However, I forgot about it just after two days, and I felt at peace with him. Some people might say I am silly, but I think mistake is more forgettable than friendship. Second, Everybody makes mistake. However, if you end a friendship whenever your friend makes a mistake, there will be no friends around you. I agree if a friend makes very a big mistake, we will need to end a friendship. However, when the mistake friend made was not a big problem, we need to understand friend and forgive it because a friend is a gift of our life. According to a research, 85% of people answered that a best gift is a friend.I think that a mistake can not brake friendship if it is not a big because friendship is forever and gift our life.
llm: In the intricate world of friendships, the choice to let a friend make a mistake, rather than stepping in to prevent it, is often a delicate balancing act between emotional risks and personal development. I strongly support the idea that giving a friend the space to make mistakes is preferable to intervening in a way that could potentially harm the friendship.Primarily, permitting friends to make errors enables them to learn and grow as individuals. Mistakes are an inevitable part of life, and they often provide the most valuable learning experiences. For example, I recall a close friend who once decided to invest in a questionable business venture. Although I had the opportunity to warn him and prevent the mistake, I chose to let him navigate the situation on his own. When the investment ultimately failed, my friend gained invaluable insights into the importance of thorough research and prudent financial decisions, rather than damaging our friendship. By confronting the consequences of his actions, he became more cautious and informed in his subsequent decisions.Furthermore, excessive intervention can lead to feelings of resentment or unease in a friendship. Friendships flourish on the basis of mutual respect and trust. If one friend feels overly controlled or judged, it can create tension and potentially harm the relationship. To illustrate this point, consider the experience of another friend who faced criticism for her choice of romantic partner. After reflecting on her situation and experiencing the natural consequences, she eventually made an informed decision about the relationship, and our friendship remained intact. Had I pressured her to end the relationship, it could have created an uncomfortable dynamic in our interactions.Ultimately, while it can be challenging to watch friends make mistakes, these experiences are essential for their growth and development. By giving friends the autonomy to make mistakes and learn from them, we reinforce their independence and strengthen our bonds, ultimately leading to more profound and resilient friendships.

question: One of the best ways that parents can help their teenage children prepare for adult life is to encourage them to take a part-time job.
human: Nowadays, the society has become exceedingly competitive than ever before, parents have the responsibilitis to teach their children to survive and to be indepedent from them, just as animals teach their offspring skills of finding foods. Parents can use many methods to guide them to achieve that, for example, asking them to do some housework or clean the rooms by themselves. In my views, I agree that it is the best way for teenage children to take a part-time job to prepare their adult life for several reasons.First of all, when children get a job, they are able to earn money by themselves, instead of getting pocket money from their parents. Thus, it is an oppertunity to learn how to deal with money. Take me as an example, when I was 16, I found a job during summer vacation and earned some money by own. At the beginning of the semester, I was told to buy a text book. Unfortunately, I spent most of my salary hanging out with my friend. Therefore, I finally realized that I should learn to make a plan before I spend my money, and that did influence me in my life now.Secondly, by taking a part-time job, they certainly have to be responsible for anything they have done. For instance, if a student get a job in a company but he is frequently late for work, the company may reduce his payment or even fire him. To compare with the school life, they might suffer only a small punishment at school. Under the circumstances, he will learn that he has to obey the rule and take responsibility for their work.In conclusion, to help their children to adapt adult life, parents should let them experience it as much as they can. Due to the reasons given above, to encourage children taking a part-time job is a good choice for them to get prepared for adult life.
llm: One of the most efficient methods for parents to prepare their teenage children for adulthood is to motivate them to secure a part-time job. Working during adolescence offers numerous benefits, including the opportunity to earn a personal income and develop essential life skills that will serve them well in the future.Primarily, a part-time job fosters a sense of responsibility in teenagers. By balancing work with academic obligations, they acquire effective time management skills, learning to prioritize tasks, manage their schedules, and meet deadlines - all of which are crucial in adulthood. This experience lays the groundwork for improved time management strategies when they eventually enter university or the full-time workforce.Furthermore, part-time employment exposes teenagers to real-world settings, enabling them to refine their interpersonal skills. Interactions with colleagues, supervisors, and clients facilitate the development of their communication skills and teach them the value of teamwork. These experiences enhance their collaborative work abilities and increase their adaptability and resilience in the face of challenges.Moreover, a part-time job promotes financial awareness among teenagers. By earning their own income, they gain practical experience in budgeting, saving, and wise spending. This hands-on experience helps them understand the value of money and develop a sense of financial responsibility, which is vital when they eventually manage their own finances as adults.Lastly, engaging in part-time work can facilitate career exploration for teenagers. Exposure to diverse job roles and industries allows them to discover their passions and interests, ultimately guiding their future educational and career choices. This self-awareness enables them to pursue paths that align with their aspirations.In summary, encouraging teenagers to take on part-time jobs provides them with vital life skills, enhances their financial literacy, and supports their career development. By supporting this opportunity, parents can significantly contribute to preparing their children for the complexities of adult life.

question: It is better for children to grow up in the countryside than in a big city. Do you agree or disagree? Use specific reasons and examples to develop your essay.
human: It’s certainly better for children to grow up in a big city. Of course you need to choose a good neighborhood. I hold this belief because of two main reasons, academic and social reasons.Some people thinks that if a child grows up in a big city they will be all day at home at the computer or at the video-game, but this is not true if you live in a neighborhood with other people about your age as I did. My friends and I used to play soccer, bike, climb trees and do a lot of other stuff every day. We did play video-games, but that wasn't our main activity. In a big city there are more kinds of people and more things to do.I have a friend that grew up in the countryside. He said that he had to study a lot to pass the test to enter the university. This is another downside of growing up in the countryside. In a big city you have more qualified teachers and a better access to technology.Growing up in the countryside is not such a good experience, you won’t know a lot of people, there are gossips everywhere, and your life will be really limited. If someday I have children, I’m absolutely sure that they will grow up in a good neighborhood of a big city and they will be very happy about it.
llm: Raising a child in a rural setting has numerous benefits that can have a profound impact on their development, making it a more desirable environment than the fast-paced and overwhelming atmosphere of a large city. While cities offer advantages such as access to educational institutions and cultural diversity, the countryside provides a range of comprehensive benefits that promote a child's overall growth and well-being.One of the primary advantages of growing up in the countryside is the opportunity to connect with nature. Children in rural areas often develop a deep appreciation for the environment through outdoor activities like hiking, farming, and exploring local wildlife, which fosters creativity, curiosity, and a sense of adventure. Research has demonstrated that spending time in natural settings can improve concentration, reduce stress, and promote healthy emotional development. In contrast, urban children are often exposed to pollution, congestion, and other environmental stressors that can negatively impact their well-being.Furthermore, the rural lifestyle tends to promote strong community bonds and social connections. Children who grow up in the countryside often form close relationships with their neighbors and family members, which instills important values like cooperation, empathy, and mutual respect. This sense of community is essential for healthy social development, as it allows children to develop essential life skills like communication, conflict resolution, and teamwork. In contrast, urban children may feel isolated and disconnected from their community, despite being surrounded by people, due to the competitive and fast-paced nature of city life. This can lead to increased feelings of loneliness, anxiety, and depression, which are less common in smaller, close-knit rural communities.Another significant advantage of growing up in the countryside is the increased safety and security. Lower crime rates, reduced traffic hazards, and a more relaxed pace of life provide children with the freedom to explore, play, and engage in outdoor activities independently, which fosters autonomy, confidence, and self-reliance. These traits are essential for healthy development, as they allow children to develop problem-solving skills, take calculated risks, and learn from their mistakes.In conclusion, while city living has its advantages, the countryside offers a unique and ideal environment for children to grow and develop. The combination of a natural and nurturing environment, strong community bonds, and increased safety provides children with the perfect backdrop to develop emotionally, socially, and physically. For these reasons, I firmly believe that growing up in the countryside is more beneficial for children than growing up in a large and bustling city.

question: Do you agree or disagree with the following statement? Parents are the best teachers. Use specific reasons and examples to support your answer.
human: I completely agree that parents are the best teacher. Children normally think that their parents are somehow special and that makes them the most important people in the children’s lives.Firstly, the things that parents say have great power to their child. More power than any friend or other adult could have. For example, if someone tells a kid that something is wrong and they shouldn't do it, but his father told him/her that it was right, the kid will listen to the father instead of the other person, even if his father is wrong.Secondly, a child normally spends more time with their parents than with other people, so their parents have more time to teach him/her than anybody else. They have more contact and more intimacy with their children. Lastly, children usually mirror themselves on their parents. That’s as important thing because even if the parents don’t intend to teach their children something, they are always observing and learning by themselves. So, if there is a man that beats his wife and treats her bad, his child probably is going to be rude and treat girls bad.All in all, I agree that parents are the greatest teachers and I think that they should be very careful with what they say and do in front of their child, because it can define who he is going to be.
llm: The notion that parents are the best teachers is a complex issue that deserves thorough examination, as it involves various viewpoints on education and learning. Although I recognize the significant role parents play in imparting vital life lessons and values, I disagree that they are the best teachers. This is because learning is a multifaceted process that goes beyond the family setting.The primary reason for this is that education extends far beyond the home. Trained educators are equipped to provide a comprehensive curriculum and employ a range of teaching methods that cater to different learning styles. For example, a skilled teacher can use multimedia resources, group discussions, and hands-on activities to engage students in ways that parents, without formal training, may not be able to replicate. Furthermore, teachers offer access to a broad range of knowledge across multiple subjects, introducing students to concepts that may not naturally arise in a home setting.Moreover, the social aspect of education is crucial and cannot be overlooked. Schools are miniature versions of the larger world, where children learn essential social skills like teamwork, empathy, and communication through interactions with peers and authority figures outside their family. A child who primarily learns from their parents may lack opportunities to develop these vital interpersonal skills, which are necessary for success in both personal and professional life.That being said, it is undeniable that parents have a crucial role in shaping their children's character and values. As the first educators, they instill fundamental morals and guide their children through the early challenges of life. For instance, parents teach their children the importance of honesty, respect, and other core values that serve as the foundation for further education.In conclusion, while parents undoubtedly teach invaluable life lessons, the importance of formal education and the experiences gained through social interactions make professional teachers essential to a child's overall development. The most effective education is a collaborative effort that combines the wisdom of parents with the expertise of educators, ultimately providing a well-rounded education.

question: Nowadays, food has become easier to prepare. Has this change improved the way people live? Use specific reasons and examples to support your answer.
human: The Technology has developed a lot. With that development, food can be prepared more easily and it can taste a lot better than it used to. With that change, people’s lives are a lot better for several reasons. Some good reasons are about having more time and being able to prepare better food without being a good cook.Firstly, people normally have lots of things to do. Because of that, they don’t have much time to spend in the kitchen. But being able to prepare a tasty food just putting it into the microwave or into the oven is awesome. For example, if an engineer needs to make a project, but he needs to deliver it tomorrow, he could save hours preparing a food with the microwave instead of cooking everything from scratch.Secondly, when someone wants to prepare a good food alone for some reason, some time ago he/she would need to be a very good cook to prepare that food, but nowadays is very easy to prepare a healthy and tasty food. For example, if a guy wants to prepare a dinner to his girlfriend, he could just buy some food that comes with instructions. Normally you just need to put it into the oven and wait some time.All in all, that ease to prepare food has improved people’s lives. And that happened mainly because of the development of the technology. But people should be careful with what they eat, because some industrial foods are very bad for their health, so they should buy only food from well known brands.
llm: The way people prepare food has undergone a significant transformation, greatly impacting daily life and making it more convenient for many individuals. This shift has brought about numerous benefits, enhancing not only the efficiency of cooking but also the overall quality of life for people from diverse backgrounds.The integration of technology in the kitchen has been a key driver of this change, simplifying cooking processes. Appliances such as microwaves, food processors, and instant pots have made meal preparation faster, reducing cooking time. For example, a working parent can now quickly prepare a healthy meal in under 30 minutes, a task that would have taken hours in the past. This increased efficiency aligns with the fast pace of modern life and allows families to spend more time together, strengthening their bonds.Beyond convenience, easier meal preparation has also led to healthier eating habits. The availability of pre-prepared and portioned ingredients has encouraged individuals to cook at home rather than opting for fast food or takeout. This trend promotes healthier eating choices, as home-cooked meals are often more nutritious and can be tailored to specific dietary requirements. For instance, someone trying to manage their weight can prepare meals using fresh vegetables and lean proteins, avoiding high-calorie takeout options.Furthermore, the cultural significance of food preparation has not diminished with these changes; rather, it has evolved. The proliferation of online resources, including cooking blogs, YouTube channels, and meal preparation apps, has made learning about different cuisines more accessible. Even those with no prior cooking experience can now learn to prepare a variety of flavorful dishes from around the world in the comfort of their own kitchens.In conclusion, advancements in food preparation methods have undoubtedly enhanced the way people live. By making cooking more accessible and promoting healthier eating habits, these changes have had a positive impact on both individual well-being and social relationships. Therefore, the ease of food preparation today represents a significant improvement in modern lifestyles, offering numerous benefits that enhance the quality of life for individuals from all walks of life.

question: Students should be required to take regular standardized tests to prove that they are learning
human: The issue at hand is if the schools should require students to take regular standardized exams. This issue is important because nowadays many people cast doubt on it. However, I believe that standardized tests are valuable option for educational system as long as it would help teachers to know if the students are really getting knowledge.Firstly, standardized tests are preferable due to the fact that they help teachers to fairly grade the students. For example some students are not so active on the lessons, cause they are already familiar with the issue. Therefore, exams could be the only way for teachers to see the real abilities of those students. In addition, many teachers rely only on the exam results while grading the class, so the usage of standardized tests is the superior option for them.Additionally, standardized tests can be good chance for students to apply their knowledge on practice. Since, some students may get used to simply rewriting solved problems from the blackboard, so they will never try to solve problems on their own. However, standardized tests offer them such chance. Thus, it is clear that schools should require students to take standardized tests, as long as this option helps to both sides.Finally, I think that requirement to take standardized tests is the right choice, since in this case teachers can compare the level of knowledge of different students. In any class there will be students who will show low academic performance, so teachers could work with them more intensively. I support the points of those who say that standardized tests are required over those who don’t because if the teacher would know the level of each student he would fairly share his time to all of them.Ultimately I feel that schools which obligate their students to take standardized tests are right. I belive this, due to the fact that these schools can qualitatively check if they are giving an appropriate education to their students.
llm: The relevance and importance of regular standardized testing in modern education is a highly debated and timely topic. Advocates for standardized testing claim that these evaluations are essential in determining whether students have a thorough understanding of the material being taught. By administering regular standardized tests, educational institutions can establish a consistent and reliable measure of student learning and accountability.The primary advantage of standardized testing is that it provides a structured framework for assessing student progress over time. These evaluations are designed to measure knowledge across various subjects and grade levels, enabling educators to identify knowledge gaps, pinpoint areas that require extra attention, and monitor overall learning progress. Additionally, regular testing can foster a sense of responsibility and dedication among students, encouraging them to consistently engage with the curriculum, develop effective study habits, and acquire essential learning strategies that promote lifelong educational success.Furthermore, standardized tests serve as a means of accountability for students, educators, and school systems alike. By evaluating the effectiveness of teaching methods and curricula, educational authorities can make informed decisions about resource allocation and necessary educational reforms. This accountability drives both students and teachers to strive for educational excellence.Although critics of standardized testing often express concerns about the potential for stress and its negative impact on student wellbeing, thoughtful implementation of these assessments can minimize anxiety. Strategies such as incorporating practice tests, providing sufficient preparation resources, and designing tests that cater to diverse student abilities can lead to a more positive and productive testing experience.In conclusion, the implementation of regular standardized testing has the potential to improve educational outcomes. By providing a standard for evaluating both student learning and teaching effectiveness, standardized tests can facilitate continuous improvement in the educational landscape, ultimately contributing to the overarching goal of achieving academic mastery and success.

question: Do you agree or disagree with the following statement? A university education should be provided free of charge to all interested scholars
human: A famous proverb “Knowledge is power” has demonstrated the value of education. I believe that universities should provide free of cost education to the interested scholars because now-a-days universities with good name charge high fees and this leads one to think about affordability. I have observed that many of the interested scholars failed to get the admission in good universities because they have to think about work along with the studies, and this left them with only one choice, which is work.University is more likely to become a money making business, the issue of affordability has become crucial to the students. In today’s world education is getting expensive, and people are tending to apply for self-finance education in order to get the admission. Whereas, the scholars are facing a lot of difficulties apart from their high requirements of previous education, they has a lot to face the other difficulties and burden while getting admission such as accommodation, food, traveling, clothing, etc.Moreover, it is hard to get manage two things at a time for instance, working and studying is not an easy job for the scholars, they need to concentrate on their studies. MPhils and PhDs scholars are probably engage in the research work, which takes their full concentration and surveys. The idea of free of charge education inspires those scholars who really want to put their efforts and get a degree from best universities.Therefore, universities have to look over the issues face by most of the scholars; their message should be spread education, not making money, and motivate those scholars who want to get education. Their notion should be inspirational in such a way which makes our society educative and increase our literacy rate.
llm: The issue of whether higher education should be free for all prospective students is a topic of considerable discussion. I strongly support the notion that university education should be accessible to everyone, regardless of financial means, as it promotes equality, fosters personal and societal advancement, and tackles the pressing issue of skill shortages in the workforce.Firstly, offering free university education is inherently egalitarian. Financial constraints often prevent talented students from pursuing higher education, resulting in a loss of potential and diverse perspectives. By making education affordable, students from different socioeconomic backgrounds can access the same quality of education, contributing to a more just society. This approach enables individuals to reach their full potential based on merit, rather than their financial situation.Furthermore, free university education can greatly contribute to personal and societal progress. Without the burden of tuition fees, students are more likely to pursue fields that align with their passions and abilities, rather than those that offer immediate financial gains. This freedom encourages innovation and creativity, fostering a more educated and skilled population that can navigate complex global challenges. Moreover, a well-educated workforce is crucial for economic growth, as countries with higher education levels tend to experience increased productivity and innovation.Additionally, providing free university education helps address the skill shortages faced by many industries. As technology advances, there is a growing need for professionals with specialized knowledge and skills. By removing financial obstacles, we can encourage more students to pursue critical fields such as science, technology, engineering, and mathematics (STEM). A skilled workforce can drive economic progress and ensure that communities can adapt to evolving job markets.In conclusion, university education should indeed be provided free of charge to all interested students. This policy would not only create equal opportunities for students from diverse backgrounds but also stimulate personal growth, economic development, and social equality, making it a crucial step towards a more prosperous and equitable society.

question: Some people think university professors should spend more time doing research while others think they should spend more time educating students. What is your view?Ê
human: Although professors in a university are basically teachers who do the most important thing, teaching, we cannot ignore one more influential aspect that they are always busy with, doing research. In my opinion, a professor should spend more time doing research rather than educating students for a few reasons following.A professor means a researcher or an expert of a specific science subject. He or she should always keep the passion in her field so that he or she could push him/herself forward all the time. And then he or she can do better in teaching works. For instance, the most impressive professor during my studying in university is Mr. Yang who keeps in researching and reading. He is also the one who gave us inspiration and taught us the way to study more efficient by ourselves. All of my classmates gave him a rank of AAA, the excellent teacher.As for students, we can get what we want to know from textbooks, webs or teachers. But we can only turn to our professors when we want to take part in a research and to get ourselves promoted. If a professor doesn't get any researching works, he cannot give us the opportunity. In addition, a professor who is concentrate in his or her research is thinking and creating new ideas all the time. He or she may stimulate us students to come up with some creative sugesstions. That is good for both of the professor and students.Finally, all professors in the university are fortune of the society. They are the leaders almost in every fields of science, arts, culture and so on. Without their research, there will be no new technologies come out quickly. Without their research, there will be more artcrafts being ruined by nothing. Without their research, there will be less information of our ancestors to be known on the earth.In conclusion, a professor should do their research all the time during their careers as a teacher in university. And it's worth to spend more time on it than on teaching.
llm: The debate surrounding the role of university professors has been ongoing, with a particular focus on the balance between research and teaching responsibilities. In my opinion, the primary focus of professors should be on educating students, although research is also a vital aspect of their job.The core mission of a university is to provide students with the knowledge and skills necessary for their future careers, making education the foundation upon which academic institutions are built. When professors allocate sufficient time to teaching, they create a stimulating learning environment that encourages critical thinking, intellectual curiosity, and a deeper understanding of the subject matter. By providing individualized attention to students, professors can help them better comprehend complex concepts. Moreover, professors who are invested in their students' education have the power to inspire and transform lives, extending beyond the academic sphere.While research is undoubtedly crucial in academia, as it fuels innovation and boosts a university's reputation, which in turn attracts funding and distinguished faculty, an overemphasis on research can lead to a detachment between professors and students. If professors are overly engrossed in their research, they may not be as accessible to offer the support and mentorship that students require. This imbalance can have a negative impact on the learning experience of students, who greatly benefit from engaging with faculty members who are committed to teaching.The optimal situation is one where research and teaching are balanced in harmony. Professors should engage in research, but not at the cost of their fundamental role as educators. By integrating their research findings into the curriculum, professors can offer students cutting-edge knowledge, making the learning experience both pertinent and impactful. In summary, while research is significant, the priority should always be on nurturing and educating students, as they will be the future innovators and leaders of our society.

question: How do television or movies influence people's behavior? Use reasons and specific examples to explain your answer.
human: There is no doubt that television or movies influence people’s behavior and they influence us in both bad ways and good ways. But I think in general television and movies influence our behavior in bad ways more than in good ways. They make people to eat more rubbish food, spend less time with their friends and family, and be someone that are not themselves. There are a lot of people eating foods or snacks when they are watching television. Most of the foods they eat are fat foods like chips or pizzas. It is not rocket science to know that these foods are not good for people’s health. Many companies know about this behavior and use advertisements on television to make people buy more of these foods. In turn, people will consume these rubbish foods more and we have to deal with a lot of fat diseases.Television and movies also make people to spend more time on their couch than with their family and friends, especially children. They communicate less with their parents because a lot of their time is used watching television and movies. When people are watching television or movies together, they also talk less to each other, compare to when playing social games, such as parlor games, together.Television and movies nowadays contain a lot of advertisements. These advertisements build ideal images that make people to feel bad about themselves and want to be more like these images. When people see beautiful women and men on the advertisements, they think that they are ugly. Thus they spend a lot of money to buy a lot of beauty products or go to gym to get better appearance or body. When a cool hero characters in a movie smokes and yet a lot of people like him, then people who idolize him may also begin to smoke although they don’t prefer it.I think television and movies are entertaining but most of the time they influence people’s behavior in bad ways. If you want to stay healthy, be yourself and spend time with your family and friends, then you should spend less time watching these media.
llm: The media, including television and movies, has a profound impact on people's behavior, influencing societal norms and individual actions in multiple ways. This influence can be understood through three key mechanisms: imitation, desensitization, and altered perceptions of reality.Many people imitate the behaviors of characters they admire, a phenomenon known as social learning theory. For instance, research has shown that watching superheroes on TV can encourage children to exhibit pro-social behaviors, such as sharing and helping others. On the other hand, exposure to violent content can increase aggressive behaviors, as seen in the "copycat" effect where viewers mimic violent acts depicted on screen.Additionally, repeated exposure to certain themes can lead to desensitization, causing individuals to become less responsive to violence, moral dilemmas, or other issues portrayed in the media. For example, regular viewers of action movies may start to see violence as a normal way to resolve conflicts, influencing their approach to real-life disputes. This desensitization can decrease empathy and increase the acceptance of violent solutions to problems like crime.Furthermore, the media shapes our understanding of reality by presenting distorted or exaggerated narratives. Reality TV shows, for example, often depict unrealistic lifestyles and relationships, leading viewers to adopt misguided ideals about wealth, beauty, and success. This can drive consumerist behaviors, where individuals feel pressured to emulate the extravagant lifestyles they see on screen.In summary, television and movies significantly influence behavior through imitation, desensitization, and shaping perceptions of reality. As the media continues to evolve, it is crucial for viewers to critically evaluate the content they consume, mitigating potentially harmful effects on their behavior and societal norms.

question: Many people visit museums when they travel to new places. Why do you think people visit museums? Use specific reasons and examples to support your answer.
human: Many people like to visit museums when they travel to new places, other people don't like to visit museums. I personaly tend to visit museums when I'm in a new place because it's good for me know about the culture, tradition and history of other places.The first reason why people are willing to visit museums when they travel to a new territory is that museums provide a tremendous amount of information about different aspects of the history and culture of that place, as I said back. And also taking the chance for making friends. Visit museums can bring you the opportunity to establish relations and knowledge to participate in conversations. And that kind of knowledge speaks very highly of you.However, other people visit museums are the most boring expirience of a trip. My cousin Pedro literaly hates to visit museums but he really enjoyed his visit to the famous London - Madame Tussaud museum, it was kind of art entertainment but also that visit helped him to understand the artist works, and in addition he started to respect and admire other types of arts that offers in other museums.In coclusion, the museums are a visual source to know the history, tradition and culture of any place in the world. I think it's fun and educational.
llm: When exploring new destinations, many travelers prioritize visiting museums, driven by a range of compelling motivations. These include a desire to gain insight into local culture and history, to immerse themselves in art and creativity, and to forge connections with the community.Museums play a pivotal role in facilitating an understanding of a location's history and cultural heritage. By housing a plethora of artifacts and exhibits, they narrate the story of a place, its inhabitants, and its transformation over time. For example, a visit to the British Museum in London offers the chance to discover ancient Egyptian relics and Greek sculptures, providing profound insights into the civilizations that have shaped our world. Through the examination of these historical artifacts, travelers acquire not only knowledge but also a deeper appreciation for the cultural context of their surroundings.Moreover, museums are treasure troves of artistic expression, providing a platform for creativity to flourish. Art aficionados flock to galleries and museums to experience the masterpieces of celebrated artists in person, an experience that far surpasses viewing images online or in print. The Louvre in Paris, for instance, allows visitors to stand in awe before iconic works like the Mona Lisa or the Venus de Milo, fostering a profound and visceral connection to the art that transcends mere observation. This engagement with art has the power to inspire, provoke thought, and enrich the travel experience.Finally, museum visits foster a sense of community and connection with the local populace. Many museums host a variety of events, including lectures and workshops, that encourage interaction and dialogue. Engaging with locals in these settings provides travelers with unique viewpoints and insights, thereby enhancing their cultural understanding. Community-oriented museums in smaller towns, for example, may feature local talent or historians, allowing visitors to engage with the essence and spirit of the community.In summary, museums are indispensable stops for travelers, offering unparalleled opportunities to delve into history, appreciate art, and forge connections with local culture, thereby rendering each visit an unforgettable component of the journey.

question: Do you agree or disagree with the following statement: In a busy and crowded world, we should not expect people to be polite to others.
human: Once a celebrity said: A man's manner is a mirror that reflects his virtues. Recently, the social environment we lived with busy noises and crowded spaces in case that people pay less attentions on their behaviors and manners. They are being rude towards others. Due to this phenomenon, someone suggests that we should not expect people to be polite to other. Obviously, I do not agree with such kind of altitudes, the explanations I explored would be stated as following.First of all, a person with good manner will give others a fine personal impression. Through those impressions, a person was easily to get acquired with others and blended with the community that surrounded him as soon as possible. For example, I worked in a new company, if I am a guy with good manners and treating everyone well, my new colleagues will accept me, even then I will be approved by the employers. In opposite situation if I am being rude, I can not get along well with each other. Finally, I will be fired and have no other choice but lost my job.Secondly, people will get respect from politeness within each other. Politeness and tender words not only can help the speaker to earn a good reputation but also that encourage the listeners who were in need. A successful corporation must have a relationship with respect and pleasure. There are many more facts have improved that people with politeness are easily to be succeed, because from their behaviors, they made their partners or opponents to find their own individual dignity.Finally, the society needs a civilized environment and orders. And a degree of social civilization depend on its people's qualities. In order to create a better living environment for ourselves and our offsprings, our behaviors must be asked with politeness and good manners. Benefit from those effective measures, there may be an obvious effect on the reducing of criminal rate.All in all, I suppose that people should be polite to others in a such busy and crowded world.
llm: In today's fast-paced and crowded society, the demands of daily life can sometimes lead to neglect of basic social etiquette, causing some individuals to assume that expecting courtesy from others is unrealistic. I, however, strongly argue against this viewpoint. Being polite is not just a nicety; it's a vital component of human interaction that promotes harmony, maintains respectful relationships, and fosters a sense of community, even in the midst of modern life's chaos.The primary importance of politeness lies in its ability to facilitate smooth communication. Even in challenging situations, such as densely populated public transport or busy urban settings, a simple act of courtesy like expressing gratitude or saying please can greatly improve the atmosphere and encourage cooperation. When we exhibit polite behavior, we acknowledge the shared humanity that binds us together, creating a sense of belonging that is essential in today's often impersonal world.Furthermore, anticipating courtesy from others promotes a culture that values empathy and respect. When we prioritize kindness, even in brief interactions, it creates a positive impact that can inspire others to emulate the same behavior. This is particularly significant in high-stress environments where a polite demeanor can greatly alleviate tension. By upholding courtesy standards, we enhance our personal interactions and contribute to a more harmonious and compassionate society.It's also crucial to understand that expecting politeness doesn't ignore the realities of modern life. Although people might be stressed or preoccupied, acknowledging these circumstances should motivate us to act with increased empathy and understanding. Recognizing human imperfections shouldn't be an excuse to abandon kindness; rather, it should encourage us to strive for compassion and consideration.In conclusion, instead of giving up on expecting politeness in an increasingly crowded world, we should cling to this principle. It enhances our interactions, promotes respect, and ultimately contributes to a more empathetic society that functions smoothly amidst daily challenges.

question: Do you agree or disagree with the following statement? Most experiences in our lives that seemed difficult at the time become valuable lessons for the future. Use reasons and specific examples to support your answer.
human: There is a famous old saying that failure is the mother of success. For that reason, some people advocate that some difficulties people met at their early ages will become an invaluable fortune in their future lives. However, some people think it isn't supposed to be that case. From my point of view, I am in favor the former statement that some tough experiences people met before will be helpful in their life path.To start with, hardship makes people realize how to cherish and compliment the common but wonderful little things happened in their life such as, a shining weather, a delicious breakfast and etc. People who have such nice spirit usually know how to find the true love in their life instead of being seduced by greed as to lose themselves in the end. As a result, experiences of difficulties teach them how to keep a nice mood and have confidence all the time.What's more, people who experienced lots of difficulties will be calmer when they are in troubles. Because they already have such experiences of overcoming some difficulties, they are conscious of what to do and how to do when fierce crisis happens. Those people are more likely to achieve their ambitions in their career because they are aware of how to lead people to reach success despite what kind of difficulties are getting in their way.So, to sum it up, both not afraid of difficulties and appreciating common but pleasant things in their lives drive me to believe that most tough experiences in people's life path will be a priceless treasure to them. Remember if you are afraid of encountering difficulties, then you will be in the troubles all the time.
llm: I wholeheartedly endorse the idea that the majority of life's experiences, despite appearing daunting at the time, eventually transform into invaluable lessons for the future. Life is filled with obstacles that put our resilience, adaptability, and comprehension to the test. Although these moments can be uncomfortable or even painful, they frequently serve as pivotal turning points that facilitate personal growth and development.A compelling argument in support of this notion is that difficult experiences inherently offer opportunities for introspection and self-discovery. For example, consider the experience of failing an examination. Initially, this failure may seem devastating, leading to feelings of disappointment and self-doubt. Nevertheless, upon reflection, such an experience could motivate the individual to reassess their study habits, seek assistance from peers or tutors, and ultimately develop a more profound understanding of the subject matter. This novel approach not only enhances academic performance but also fosters a growth mindset, enabling the individual to confront future challenges with increased confidence.Furthermore, overcoming adversity often cultivates resilience, an essential trait required in both personal and professional realms. For instance, an individual who faces job loss may initially perceive it as a disastrous setback. Yet, this experience may lead them to explore novel career paths, acquire additional qualifications, or even establish their own business. The challenges encountered during unemployment can instill a stronger sense of determination and adaptability that proves invaluable in future pursuits.Lastly, many of life's most challenging moments enrich our empathy and understanding of others. When we encounter struggles, we become more attuned to the difficulties of those surrounding us. As a result, we evolve into more compassionate individuals, capable of offering support and guidance to others in need.In conclusion, challenging experiences, although often disheartening at the moment, ultimately evolve into valuable life lessons. They cultivate self-awareness, resilience, and empathy, molding us into stronger individuals equipped to navigate the complexities of life.

question: Life in a city is much better than life in the countryside
human: As far as I am concerned, I agree with the statement that life in a city is much better than life in the countryside.Firstly, in the city there is much better education system. This means, that the schools and the universities have well equipped classes and the famous professors would like to work in such places.In addition, I believe that city provides more work opportunities than the countryside. There are not only more jobs, but they are also well-paid. Of course living in a city is more expensive, but incomes are higher too.Moreover, in the urban areas there are also more citizens what means, that the culture diversity is huge. Meeting and knowing new people's tradition is an unforgettable experience, which could influence on one's previous habits.Furthermore, the city has well-organised lines of transport.
